story:
Version Française (Text in English below)

Goma Dance Festival (GDF en sigle), est une initiative des jeunes danseurs de la ville de Goma en collaboration avec quelques jeunes opérateurs culturels de cette ville touristique de l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo.

Un festival international et une rencontre annuelle de danses urbaines, contemporaines et traditionnelles, dont le but est de promouvoir, soutenir et renforcer les capacités de danseurs locaux avec une formation professionnelle grâce aux différents ateliers.
Le festival se situe entre la rue et la scène. Amour, joie et unité y sont présentes. Différents danseurs africains et danseurs professionnels internationaux s’y rassemblent, afin de dépasser les barrières politiques, culturelles, ethniques et rassembler les gens autour du langage commun « la danse »

Au programme vous trouverez :
> Un mois de compétition de danse en solo et ou en groupes,
> Des formations professionnelles et créations en danse et autres disciplines de la culture Hip-Hop,
> Une semaine d’animations en danses, Performances, Battle, ateliers, débats et conférences, tourisme
> Des rencontres et échanges avec des professionnels internationaux de la danse

- Téléchargez le Rapport 2019

- Téléchargez le Rapport 2018

- Téléchargez le Rapport 2017

Suite au succès et la réussite de trois éditions passées, cette année 2021 nous avons décidé de réorganiser la quatrième édition du GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL, qui normalement devrait se passée en Avril 2020, mais elle a été annuler suite au respect de mesures des préventions contre la pandémie du COVID-19.
Cette année, nous allons refaire le festival avec une éditions sous un autre format d'une courte durée.

Au programme cette année 2021 vous trouverez :

- GOMA DANCE CAMP : 10 jours, dont 8 heures par jour de formations, échanges et créations de spectacles en danses urbaines, traditionnelles et contemporaine, des échanges et initiation à la culture Hip-Hop et ses disciplines : (Graffiti, Djying, Beat-Boxing,...),
Ces activités seront animées par des danseurs professionnels nationaux, régionaux et internationaux et seront gratuites pour tous les participants. Le but est de renforcer les capacités de danseurs congolais pour un développement professionnel

- GDF CHAMPIONSHIPS : Une compétition de danses urbaines pour enfants et adultes, dont le but est de donner aux danseurs l’occasion de présenter leurs arts et techniques et en choisir les meilleurs.
Les gagnants sont récompensés par des opportunités de voyager à l’étranger dans la région et à l’international pour représenter la R.D Congo dans d’autres festivals et compétitions partenaires.

- Conférences : Journée de discussions et réflexions sur les pistes de solutions aux problèmes liées à l’évolution et le développement de la danse et la culture Hip-hop à Goma et en RD Congo,

- GDF Théâtre : organiser une soirée d’exhibition de pièce de danse du genre Hiphop Theater et contemporaine qui seront présentées par différentes compagnie de danse de Goma et d’ailleurs. Mais aussi par la même occasion présenter aux public certains spectacles crées les ateliers lors du GOMA DANCE CAMP.

- GDF TOURS : La ville Goma étant la capitale touristique de la République Démocratique du Congo, comme chaque année le festival organisera une visite touristique avec les invités à la fin du festival afin de promouvoir l’esprit du tourisme et montrer la beauté du pays.

Pourquoi  le Festival ?

En R.D.Congo, plusieurs jeunes danseurs sont talentueux, mais manquent de formations ou stages professionnelles. Ils sont tous abandonné à leur propre sort et ne bénéficient d’aucune promotion ou soutien. En grandissant la majorité abandonne la danse suite au manque de promotion, d’espace d’expression ou d’un moyen de franchir les étapes vers une carrière professionnelle. C’est pour soutenir et promouvoir ces jeunes courageux et talentueux, que nous avons pensé à créer GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL afin de leur offrir des opportunités pour une carrière professionnelle et un espace d’expression.

Les objectifs :

• Créer un événement annuel pour montrer l’importance et la valeur de danse urbaine, contemporaine et traditionnelle à la jeunesse congolaise.

• Promouvoir et renforcer les capacités de jeunes danseurs, leur permettre de se prendre en charge dans leurs créations et le soutenir pour un développement professionnel.

• Promouvoir le respect, la liberté et solidarité pour consolider la paix et la cohabitation dans la région des grands-lacs Africain.

• Permettre aux danseurs d’échanger et de s’exprimer librement, afin qu’ils se sentent égaux et valorisés

• Cultiver dans la communauté un gout de soutien et de promotion de la danse urbaine et contemporaine comme une profession artistique et un élément important pour le développement de la jeunesse.

De quoi avons-nous besoin ?

Grâce à l’implication et l’engagement des danseurs de la région, cette édition sera encore une réussite.

Cette année, nous travaillons en étroite collaboration avec l’Institut Français de Goma pour prise en charge de l’hébergement des artistes venants de l'étranger. des danseurs visiteurs. L'Institut Françcais nous donne aussi un espace pour les ateliers et autres

Le centre Kivu Youth Entertainment qui va s'occuper du multimédia et la documentation (photos +vidéos), le festival Batalo East qui accueille  en Ouganda, les gagnants de notre complétion de danse GDF Championship et le Détours Festival qui accueille aussi les gagnants de notre complétion de danse en Belgique, la structure PROJET KONGO, un collectif de danseurs congolais  professionnels internationaux de la diaspora, qui nous aide artistiquement et financièrement et bien d’autres structures et personnes de bonne volonté nous tendent la mains.

Pour cette 4ème édition, cette collecte de fonds vise à rassembler le montant pour couvrir :

-          les couts de transport des artistes nationaux

-          la location de la salle de spectacles pour la compétition et les spectacles

-          les couts de la restauration des danseurs invités et des bénévoles.

Ce que vous obtenez :

Un réel sentiment de satisfaction et de joie à aider un groupe de jeunes passionnés et motivés.

Mais aussi pour ceux qui ceci intéresse :

- pour $10 : une lettre de remerciement

- pour $20 ; une Carte de vœux

- pour $30 : une photo GDF personnalisée

- pour $50 : une Carte de vœux et une photo GDF personnalisée

- pour $200 : un Joli portrait (dessin) de toi

- pour $500 : Parrain officiel, une lettre de remerciement, une carte de vœux, une photo GDF personnalisée, Joli portrait (dessin) de toi

L’impact :

Votre soutien va contribuer à ceci:

• Des milliers de jeunes seront réunis pour promouvoir le respect, la liberté et solidarité pour consolider la paix et la cohabitation dans la région des grands-lacs Africain

• Les capacités de jeunes danseurs seront renforcées pour une future carrière professionnelle

• Les gagnants à GDF Championship vont participer à d’autres festivals au niveau international

• La communauté de la région développe le gout de soutien et de promotion de la danse urbaine et contemporaine comme une profession artistique et un élément important pour le développement de la jeunesse.

Pour nous aider à faire en sorte que cet évènement se réalise, vous pouvez :

- Faire une donation

- Partager sans modération cette page avec vos proches

- Nous suivre sur : Facebook, Instagram, Twitter

Et vous êtes bien sûr les bienvenus au Goma, au festival, et venez visiter ce magnifique endroit! Grand Merci!

Contacts:

Tél: +243 852 525 098, +243 991 238 230

Mail: gomadancefest@gmail.com

Web : http://rinhadanceprojects.org

 

ENGLISH VERSION

Goma Dance Festival (GDF acronym), is an initiative of young dancers of the city of Goma in collaboration with some young cultural operators of this tourist city in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.

An international festival and an annual meeting of urban, contemporary and traditional dances, whose aim is to promote, support and strengthen the capacities of local dancers with professional training through various workshops.
The festival is situated between the street and the stage. Love, joy and unity are present. Different African dancers and international professional dancers come together, in order to overcome political, cultural and ethnic barriers and bring people together around the common language of dance.

On the program you will find :
> A month of solo and group dance competitions,
> Professional trainings and creations in dance and other disciplines of the Hip-Hop culture,
> A week of animations in dances, performances, battles, workshops, debates and conferences, tourism
> Meetings and exchanges with international dance professionals

- Watch the 2019 festival video recap 

- Watch the 2018 festival video recap 

- Watch the  2017 festival video recap 

Following the the success of three past editions, this year 2021 we have decided to reorganize the fourth edition of the GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL, which normally should be held in April 2020, but it was cancelled following the respect of preventive measures against the pandemic of COVID-19.
This year, we will repeat the festival with a different format of a short duration.

On the program this year 2021 you will find:

- GOMA DANCE CAMP : 10 days, including 8 hours per day of training, exchange and creation of shows in urban, traditional and contemporary dances, exchanges and initiation to the Hip-Hop culture and its disciplines : (Graffiti, Djying, Beat-Boxing,...),
These activities will be animated by national, regional and international professional dancers and will be free for all participants. The goal is to strengthen the capacities of Congolese dancers for a professional development

- GDF CHAMPIONSHIPS : An urban dance competition for children and adults, whose goal is to give dancers the opportunity to present their arts and techniques and choose the best.
Winners are rewarded with opportunities to travel abroad in the region and internationally to represent D.R. Congo in other festivals and partner competitions.

- Conferences: A day of discussions and reflections on solutions to problems related to the evolution and development of dance and hip-hop culture in Goma and in DR Congo,

- GDF Theater : to organize an evening of exhibition of dance piece of the genre Hiphop Theater and contemporary which will be presented by various dance companies of Goma and elsewhere. But also by the same occasion to present to the public some shows created the workshops during the GOMA DANCE CAMP.

- GDF TOURS : The city of Goma being the tourist capital of the Democratic Republic of Congo, as every year the festival will organize a tourist tour with the guests at the end of the festival in order to promote the spirit of tourism and show the beauty of the country.

Why the Festival?

In D.R. Congo, many young dancers are talented, but lack professional training or internships. They are all abandoned to their own fate and do not benefit from any promotion or support. As they grow up, the majority abandon dance due to lack of promotion, space for expression or a way to take steps towards a professional career. It is to support and promote these courageous and talented young people, that we thought of creating GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL in order to offer them opportunities for a professional career and a space for expression.

The objectives :

- To create an annual event to show the importance and value of urban, contemporary and traditional dance to the Congolese youth.

- To promote and strengthen the capacities of young dancers, enable them to take charge of their creations and support them in their professional development.

- To promote respect, freedom and solidarity to consolidate peace and cohabitation in the African Great Lakes region.

- To allow dancers to exchange and express themselves freely, so that they feel equal and valued

- To cultivate in the community a taste of support and promotion of urban and contemporary dance as an artistic profession and an important element for the development of the youth.

What do we need?

Thanks to the involvement and commitment of the dancers of the region, this edition will be a success again.

This year, we are working in close collaboration with the French Institute of Goma to take care of the accommodation of the artists coming from abroad. The French Institute also gives us a space for workshops and other activities.

The Kivu Youth Entertainment center which will take care of the multimedia and the documentation (photos + videos), the Batalo East festival which welcomes in Uganda, the winners of our dance competition GDF Championship and the Détours Festival which also welcomes the winners of our dance competition in Belgium, the structure PROJET KONGO, a collective of international professional Congolese dancers of the diaspora, which helps us artistically and financially and many other structures and people of good will hold out their hands to us.

For this 4th edition, this fundraiser aims to collect the amount to cover

- transportation costs of the national artists

- the rental of the auditorium for the competition and the shows

- catering costs for guest dancers and volunteers.

What you get:

A real sense of satisfaction and joy in helping a group of passionate and motivated young people.

But also for those who are interested:

- for $10 : a thank you letter

- for $20 : a Greeting Card

- for $30 : a personalized GDF photo

- for $50 : a Greeting Card and a personalized SFM photo

- for $200 : a nice portrait (drawing) of you

- for $500 : Official sponsor, thank you letter, greeting card, personalized SFM photo, nice portrait (drawing) of you

Impact :

Your support will contribute to this:

- Thousands of young people will be brought together to promote respect, freedom and solidarity to consolidate peace and cohabitation in the African Great Lakes region

- Young dancers will be empowered for a future professional career

- Winners at GDF Championship will participate in other festivals at international level

- The community of the region develops the drop of support and promotion of urban and contemporary dance as an artistic profession and an important element for the development of the youth.

To help us make this event happen, you can :

- Make a donation

- Share this page with your friends and family without moderation

- Follow us on : Facebook, Instagram, Twitter

Contacts:

Tél: +243 852 525 098, +243 991 238 230

Mail: gomadancefest@gmail.com

Web : http://rinhadanceprojects.org

And of course you are welcome to come to Goma, to the festival, and visit this beautiful place! Thanks a lot!
story_txt: Version Française (Text in English below)Goma Dance Festival (GDF en sigle), est une initiative des jeunes danseurs de la ville de Goma en collaboration avec quelques jeunes opérateurs culturels de cette ville touristique de l’Est de la République Démocratique du Congo.Un festival international et une rencontre annuelle de danses urbaines, contemporaines et traditionnelles, dont le but est de promouvoir, soutenir et renforcer les capacités de danseurs locaux avec une formation professionnelle grâce aux différents ateliers.Le festival se situe entre la rue et la scène. Amour, joie et unité y sont présentes. Différents danseurs africains et danseurs professionnels internationaux s’y rassemblent, afin de dépasser les barrières politiques, culturelles, ethniques et rassembler les gens autour du langage commun « la danse »Au programme vous trouverez :> Un mois de compétition de danse en solo et ou en groupes,> Des formations professionnelles et créations en danse et autres disciplines de la culture Hip-Hop,> Une semaine d’animations en danses, Performances, Battle, ateliers, débats et conférences, tourisme> Des rencontres et échanges avec des professionnels internationaux de la danse- Téléchargez le Rapport 2019- Téléchargez le Rapport 2018- Téléchargez le Rapport 2017Suite au succès et la réussite de trois éditions passées, cette année 2021 nous avons décidé de réorganiser la quatrième édition du GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL, qui normalement devrait se passée en Avril 2020, mais elle a été annuler suite au respect de mesures des préventions contre la pandémie du COVID-19.Cette année, nous allons refaire le festival avec une éditions sous un autre format d'une courte durée.Au programme cette année 2021 vous trouverez :- GOMA DANCE CAMP : 10 jours, dont 8 heures par jour de formations, échanges et créations de spectacles en danses urbaines, traditionnelles et contemporaine, des échanges et initiation à la culture Hip-Hop et ses disciplines : (Graffiti, Djying, Beat-Boxing,...),Ces activités seront animées par des danseurs professionnels nationaux, régionaux et internationaux et seront gratuites pour tous les participants. Le but est de renforcer les capacités de danseurs congolais pour un développement professionnel- GDF CHAMPIONSHIPS : Une compétition de danses urbaines pour enfants et adultes, dont le but est de donner aux danseurs l’occasion de présenter leurs arts et techniques et en choisir les meilleurs.Les gagnants sont récompensés par des opportunités de voyager à l’étranger dans la région et à l’international pour représenter la R.D Congo dans d’autres festivals et compétitions partenaires.- Conférences : Journée de discussions et réflexions sur les pistes de solutions aux problèmes liées à l’évolution et le développement de la danse et la culture Hip-hop à Goma et en RD Congo,- GDF Théâtre : organiser une soirée d’exhibition de pièce de danse du genre Hiphop Theater et contemporaine qui seront présentées par différentes compagnie de danse de Goma et d’ailleurs. Mais aussi par la même occasion présenter aux public certains spectacles crées les ateliers lors du GOMA DANCE CAMP.- GDF TOURS : La ville Goma étant la capitale touristique de la République Démocratique du Congo, comme chaque année le festival organisera une visite touristique avec les invités à la fin du festival afin de promouvoir l’esprit du tourisme et montrer la beauté du pays.Pourquoi  le Festival ?En R.D.Congo, plusieurs jeunes danseurs sont talentueux, mais manquent de formations ou stages professionnelles. Ils sont tous abandonné à leur propre sort et ne bénéficient d’aucune promotion ou soutien. En grandissant la majorité abandonne la danse suite au manque de promotion, d’espace d’expression ou d’un moyen de franchir les étapes vers une carrière professionnelle. C’est pour soutenir et promouvoir ces jeunes courageux et talentueux, que nous avons pensé à créer GOMA DANCE FESTIVAL afin de leur offrir des opportunités pour une carrière professionnelle et un espace d’expression.Les objectifs :• Créer un événement annuel pour montrer l’importance et la valeur de danse urbaine, contemporaine et traditionnelle à la jeunesse congolaise.• Promouvoir et renforcer les capacités de jeunes danseurs, leur permettre de se prendre en charge dans leurs créations et le soutenir pour un développement professionnel.• Promouvoir le respect, la liberté et solidarité pour consolider la paix et la cohabitation dans la région des grands-lacs Africain.• Permettre aux danseurs d’échanger et de s’exprimer librement, afin qu’ils se sentent égaux et valorisés• Cultiver dans la communauté un gout de soutien et de promotion de la danse urbaine et contemporaine comme une profession artistique et un élément important pour le développement de la jeunesse.De quoi avons-nous besoin ?Grâce à l’implication et l’engagement des danseurs de la région, cette édition sera encore une réussite.Cette année, nous travaillons en étroite collaboration avec l’Institut Français de Goma pour prise en charge de l’hébergement des artistes venants de l'étranger. des danseurs visiteurs. L'Institut Françcais nous donne aussi un espace pour les ateliers et autresLe centre Kivu Youth Entertainment qui va s'occuper du multimédia et la documentation (photos +vidéos), le festival Batalo East qui accueille  en Ouganda, les gagnants de notre complétion de danse GDF Championship et le Détours Festival qui accueille aussi les gagnants de notre complétion de danse en Belgique, la structure PROJET KONGO, un collectif de danseurs congolais  professionnels internationaux de la diaspora, qui nous aide artistiquement et financièrement et bien d’autres structures et personnes de bonne volonté nous tendent la mains.Pour cette 4ème édition, cette collecte de fonds vise à rassembler le montant pour couvrir :-          les couts de transport des artistes nationaux-          la location de la salle de spectacles pour la compétition et les spectacles-          les couts de la restauration des danseurs invités et des bénévoles.Ce que vous obtenez :Un réel sentiment de satisfaction et de joie à aider un groupe de jeunes passionnés et motivés.Mais aussi pour ceux qui ceci intéresse :- pour $10 : une lettre de remerciement- pour $20 ; une Carte de vœux- pour $30 : une photo GDF personnalisée- pour $50 : une Carte de vœux et une photo GDF personnalisée- pour $200 : un Joli portrait (dessin) de toi- pour $500 : Parrain officiel, une lettre de remerciement, une carte de vœux, une photo GDF personnalisée, Joli portrait (dessin) de toiL’impact :Votre soutien va contribuer à ceci:• Des milliers de jeunes seront réunis pour promouvoir le respect, la liberté et solidarité pour consolider la paix et la cohabitation dans la région des grands-lacs Africain• Les capacités de jeunes danseurs seront renforcées pour une future carrière professionnelle• Les gagnants à GDF Championship vont participer à d’autres festivals au niveau international• La communauté de la région développe le gout de soutien et de promotion de la danse urbaine et contemporaine comme une profession artistique et un élément important pour le développement de la jeunesse.Pour nous aider à faire en sorte que cet évènement se réalise, vous pouvez :- Faire une donation- Partager sans modération cette page avec vos proches- Nous suivre sur : Facebook, Instagram, TwitterEt vous êtes bien sûr les bienvenus au Goma, au festival, et venez visiter ce magnifique endroit! Grand Merci!Contacts:Tél: +243 852 525 098, +243 991 238 230Mail: gomadancefest@gmail.comWeb : http://rinhadanceprojects.org ENGLISH VERSIONGoma Dance Festival (GDF acronym), is an initiative of young dancers of the city of Goma in collaboration with some young cultural operators of this tourist city in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo.An international festival and an annual meeting of urban, contemporary and traditional dances, whose aim is to promote, support and strengthen the capacities of local dancers with professional training through various workshops.The festival is situated between the street and the stage. story:
Why, Hello There...

As you've surely heard by now (and if you haven't, where the heck have you been?!)...

Katie, Audrey, and Gwenevere, aka Team Ivy Theatre, have been bringing you challenging, conversation-sparking, super awesome theatre for two years; now we need your help to make it a third! 

Our goal is to put a new face on theatre: we are producing three plays this year by two female playwrights, featuring five complex female characters and the promise of a fresh perspective.

$20,000 is just a start...

We need you to get involved and be the change you wish to see. (Thanks, Gandhi!) 

Your Impact

Regional theatre companies say 50% of funding comes from grants and donations, but for indie theatre, the rate is more like 80%. Obviously, we can't do this without you.

Wait, what's Ivy Theatre about?

Hang on, you didn't read about us in the New York Times or see us as a Time Out New York's 'Critic's Pick'?! Well...
In less than 18 months, we produced 6 thought-provoking plays, plus an Off-Broadway extension, to sold-out houses.
These plays tackled issues ranging from:

  •  the struggle of coming to terms with homosexuality from both the male and female perspectives
  •  stories encompassing the transgender umbrella *featuring transgender actors*
  • questions about porn, sexual violence, and the acceptance of female sexuality
  •  the industrial exploitation of small towns
  • class and gender divides. 
The  majority of our casts have been (and will continue to be) women, people of color or LGBT actors.

So, what's on the line?

The biggest risk is not having these stories told. However, producing theatre in New York is an expensive endeavor.  If we can't raise enough funds, our ability to share these dynamic stories is limited. We have rent, sets and props to buy, and we want the artists to get paid too! Here's where your money goes for just one show:
  • $3,750 pays rent (we even share a space to save funds!)
  • $750 for actor travel stipends 
  • $1,700 (set, lighting, costume and sound designers, director, and stage manager's fees)
  • $750 (materials for set, lights, props, and costumes)
  • $1,625 (publicity and marketing materials)
  • 7% of every donation goes to fees for our fiscal sponsorship 
(We have our rehearsal space donated, which saves us $2,500 per show - BIIIIG THANKS to The TAI Group!)

Now what?

First off, thank you so much for your support! Now, we need your help spreading the word. Please invite three friends to check out this campaign, and come see our next production in May: The Perfect Wife, by Emmy-Award Winner, Karen L. Lewis.

story:
What WDMC Is Up To Now

After receiving praise from audiences and critics alike for their smash hit productions of Much Ado About Nothing and Romeo & Juliet in 2014, What Dreams May Co in partnership with Queens Shakespeare Inc. sets 2015 ablaze with controversial, brutal, modern re-imaginings of two of the classical theatre’s most horrifying yet soul searching works. Join us as we shine the looking glass on men worshiped as gods, vengeful gods walking amongst men, and the destructive might of men turned mob.  #itsallgreektome

Director Chris Rivera (Director of 2014’s critically acclaimed Romeo & Juliet) brings audiences into an apocalyptic Rome. The last glimmer of civilization surrounded by a world in ruin. The last glimmer of civilization surrounded by a world in ruin. A city where citizens starve and senators serve as assassins. Where tyrants rule with an iron fist, and are repaid by the grace of a friendly knife. Watch as honorable men become the very thing they set out to stop, while a few carefully chosen words let slip the dogs of war. 

Why Do We Need Your Help?

For the first time we are performing right in the heart of Times Square!  We are so excited to be producing at John DeSotelle Studio this spring!  Now that our rent is going up, any help you can give will be felt even more deeply.  Here's a breakdown of what you can do:

If you donate $90 you will be covering the price of a week of rehearsals.

If you donate $150 you will be covering the price of our programs.

If you donate $200 you will be covering the price of our photographer.

If you donate $1000 you will cover half a weekend of performances.

If you donate $2000 you will cover a full weekend of performances.

A contribution of any size will help us to make things happen, and makes you a part of the artistic process! So choose your favorite perk and join the team!

Who Is WDMC?

Founded in 2011, What Dreams May Co. is dedicated to making the classics accessible to all. Simple, minimalistic productions leave the focus on the language and characters, challenging the actors in the company to reach new levels and expand their knowledge of the classics. Passionate performances delve to the heart of the text, bringing the story to life in a way that connects with and immerses modern audiences. After all, “What dreams may come, when we have shuffled off this mortal coil, must give us pause.” With our productions, we hope every person has a chance to experience that moment to pause, be touched by the beauty of the language, and carry that experience with them into the world.

Who Is Queens Shakespeare?

Founded in 2005 by Nanette Asher, Queens Shakespeare, Inc. is a not-for-profit professional theatrical company, which serves Queens County and the greater New York City area. Its aim is to act as a laboratory for actors of all ages and experience levels to explore classical works and to perform in fully produced, accessible, and innovative productions. Each season one production is developed as an educational tour which is then presented at different venues throughout the state. Producing and touring in this fashion allows the company to actively contribute to the growth and vibrancy of the developing Queens arts scene, while at the same time exposing classical works to modern audiences through the educational tour.

Vote For Your Favorite!

We hope you enjoyed Imogene and Gizmo’s audition for Mark Antony's understudy! Only you can help us decide who gets the part. When donating to our IndieGoGo capaign select the perks for #teamimogen to vote for Imogen. To vote for Gizmo select the perks labeled #teamgizmo. We will tally the votes when we are halfway to our goal and then again at the end of the campaign. Stay tuned for additional video messages from Imogen and Gizmo throughout the campaign. 

Your friends at WDMC and Queens Shakespeare,
Chrissy and Jonathan

laboratory for actors of all ages and experience levels to explore 
classical works and to perform in fully produced, accessible, and 
innovative productions. Each season one production is developed as an 
educational tour which is then presented at different venues throughout 
the state. Producing and touring in this fashion allows the company to 
actively contribute to the growth and vibrancy of the developing Queens 
arts scene, while at the same time exposing classical works to modern 
audiences through the educational tour.Vote For Your Favorite!We hope you enjoyed Imogene and Gizmo’s audition
for Mark Antony's understudy! Only you can help us decide who gets the part. When donating
to our IndieGoGo capaign select the perks for #teamimogen to vote for Imogen.
To vote for Gizmo select the perks labeled #teamgizmo. We will tally the votes
when we are halfway to our goal and then again at the end of the campaign. Stay
tuned for additional video messages from Imogen and Gizmo throughout the
campaign.  Your friends at WDMC and Queens Shakespeare,Chrissy and Jonathan

story:
With all five founders having experienced a healthy New York theatrical background, we formed the LA-based JustA Theater & Production Company in 2014 with several goals in mind. We knew we needed to highlight the work of bold, female and ethnically diverse artists on stage. We knew we wanted to use elements of surrealism, magic-realism, or absurdism to elevate our plays past the ordinary interacts of everyday life. We knew we wanted to introduce and deliver the work of more provocative, multi-faceted and profound playwrights to the Los Angeles theater scene.

So when we began the process of sifting through submissions from talented playwrights across the country to create our first full season, we were struck by certain work that seemed to fit our specific ideals perfectly. We felt confident that this work could not only represent the theater company we'd like to be, but serve each audience with socially relevant commentary through the use of characters who are affected by our society, and react accordingly. Grace, Sponsored by Monteverde by Vanessa Garcia is one such work.

We believe in this play and feel confident that we can bring it to life to the extent that it deserves. In order to do that, we do need a budget that we unfortunately cannot supply ourselves.

JustA is fiscally sponsored by Unique Projects, Inc., a New York State not-for-profit 501(c)(3) organization administrated by Pentacle/DanceWorks, Inc. (Learn more at Pentacle.org.) This means that your donations are fully tax-deductible!

If you believe in the power and importance of socially relevant theater as we do, or simply trust in us as individual artists, you can help bring this arresting World Premiere to a Los Angeles stage.


What We Need & What You Get

Our minimum total budget comes to $5,600. That's the bare cost of a production that will span six weekends (12 total shows) with three nights of previews.

If we do not raise this sum, we will put all of the money we did raise into producing a smaller version of the play, which probably will mean we cannot produce it for the full six weeks.

We want to give this play as much exposure as possible, with the possibility for local press to review us. Longer runs are the way to make that happen.

Also, we believe that it is crucial for artists to be paid as adequately as possible for their work. Therefore, part of our budget is allotted to payment for all of those involved in the show. 

Here's a budget breakdown:

Space rental : $2,500
Costumes, Props  (+ Designer Wage): $400
Set Design (+ Designer Wage): $700
Light & Sound Designer (+ Wage): $330
Publicity: $500
Ticket Fees & CC Processing: $150
Other Wages (Actors, Crew): $1,000

    The Impact

    • Your support will lift and employ rising new voices - not only the talented playwright Vanessa Garcia, but the actors who will portray her dynamic characters.
    • Grace... is a play that features a female-driven lead character who also happens to come from a Cuban background. So you'll be advocating work that reflects positively upon females and first-generation Americans.
    • You will advance JustA Theater & Production Company, help grow our roots in the Los Angeles theater community, and encourage us to produce more bold new work!
    • You will make us smile, a lot... and bring joy and fulfillment to many audience members, designers, cast/crew members, etc.

    Risks & Challenges

    In September of last year, we produced our first work as a theater company: "JustA Showcase" (more info here). Consequently, we are aware of and prepared for some of the unique challenges that accompany producing live theatre. While we understand that a longer run poses more challenges, we are confident that we have the skills and abilities to solve them as they appear!
    On a more immediate basis, it will certainly be a challenge to produce the play on a smaller budget if we do not raise adequate funds. Though that outcome would be disappointing, the show must go on, and we will. But we hope you can prevent this!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't spare any money at the moment, please spread the word about this campaign and our cause to anyone you think would be even remotely interested.

    Also, please follow us on social media to help bring exposure to JustA. As a new company, this simple act is more helpful than you may imagine.

    Thanks for reading, and for your interest in JustA.
    We hope you'll join in helping us bring Grace... to a Los Angeles stage!


    All our best,

    The JustA Founders
    Shannon Godly
    Hila Melamed
    Amanda Hillsberg
    Maya Eshet
    Caitlin Maruno

    justatheater.com

story:
You can't spell Cupid without U!

From matchmaking mates to setting up a dating profile for a pal, when it comes to love, a little extra help from our friends can go a long way. I'm appealing to the wider community to help fund my fledgling love life as I take my hunt for Mr Right international with my new one woman comedy show.

Determined not to settle for second best, I'm taking my search further afield and hoping to raise money to travel to the romantic city of Edinburgh, Scotland with my new one woman comedy Diary of a Dating Addict, in partnership with MySingleFriend, at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

After many doomed dates in London, I realised I should spread my net a little further and take this to an international level, first stop Scotland.

Home to many wonderful men, Gerard Butler, Ewan McGregor, James McAvoy… and of course also the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, Scotland is literally teaming with talent and I want in.

Dating can be an expensive business, especially if you're an independent woman like myself. Or Beyoncé. Having spent all my money dating the men of London, I’ve barely got the train fare to Watford, let alone Edinburgh. So I’m turning to the public to fund this fairy tale ending.

I'm looking to raise £3.5k to fund the search for my perfect prince in Scotland. The money raised will help me pay the hire for my venue, The Gilded Balloon, for transport and go towards my accommodation whilst I stake out and search for Mr Right. 

Investors can follow my progress at @MaddyAnholt1 or use the hashtag #AskMaddy to get humorous dating tips and advice.

Sarah Beeny, TV personality and founder of MySingleFriend commented:

“We’re thrilled to be helping Maddy in her quest for romance. We all love matchmaking our single friends but this is taking it to the next level. This army of crowdfunding Cupids could be contributing to the greatest love story of our generation. At the very least a Highland fling or two. Either way, I’m sure Maddy will have a good time!”

From 5th to 31st August at 1:30pm, I will be relaying my latest dating exploits at The Study in The Gilded Balloon, Edinburgh.

I will also be bidding farewell to my London dating life in a series of comedy shows in July including the following dates:

July 3rd – Etc Theatre, 7:30pm

July 5th – Bread & Roses Theatre, Clapham, 7:30pm

July 10th – Hen & Chickens Theatre, Islington, 7:30pm

July 12th - Bath, Komedia 

July 24th – Museum of Comedy, 9:30pm 

July 26th - Brighton, Komedia

July 30th – Cutty Sark Studio, Double bill with Tom Allen, 7:30pm

Please help me fund my love life and make my dreams come true!

Thank you so much in advance.

-xxx-

"Because the rules are more like suggestions..." Lena Dunham


About Diary of a Dating Addict:

With thirty fast approaching like the Grim Wrinkler, Maddy Anholt goes online to find the man of her dreams. In this outrageous one-woman comedy, Maddy reveals every hilarious detail of a whirlwind year of dating, mating and hating.

Following the 5* sell-out success of her debut Edinburgh Fringe show, Maddy is back with this audacious new comedy.

Known for her “... effortless transformations... ” (British Comedy Guide), riotous characters and hysterical observations.

***** (EdFringeReview) **** 'Nothing short of brilliant...' (Broadway Baby) 'A remarkable talent' (Three Weeks) '…make sure you see this' (Funnywomen.com)

Partnered with MySingleFriend. 


All donations above £25 can claim
 50% discount off MySingleFriend membership
Thanks for the love! x <3 x

story:
Mixed-Race Mixtape is still able to accept your tax-deductible donations! Just click this link to go our Fiscal Sponsor!

Mixed-Race Mixtape at its core is a coming-of-age story: a young man struggling to define who he is, where he belongs. And it’s more than that, too. 

Fig, as a young, mixed-race Latino man, faces challenges unique to those whose lives are impacted by race everyday. What is it like being ‘ambiguously brown’?  How can you navigate the world as a person of color and feel proud, authentic and safe? What does it mean to be authentic?Who am I to me?

Mixed-Race Mixtape portrays the experiences that shaped one young person’s identity and through these interactions with police, teachers, friends and family, we are led to reflect on what has shaped our own identities.

Fusing theatre and Hip-Hop, Mixed-Race Mixtape makes difficult topics relatable, stirring and vivid. It’s a fun, interactive performance experience accessible to all, and specifically designed for communities typically excluded from traditional theatre spaces.

Our Mission & Impact

Re-imagine how youth of color are represented in media by changing the conversation and offering positive alternative role models.

Present content that is accessible and engaging.

Provide low-cost and free tickets at every performance.

Take the ideas and conversation sparked by the Mixed-Race Mixtape beyond the theatre doors. 

From ads and film to the evening news, we believe that media strongly influences how we shape our identities and how we think we should identify others. This is especially true for youth, and specifically youth of color, who have to look harder than their white counterparts for mainstream representations. The examples that can be found are, with few exceptions, caricatures that draw on racist stereotypes that offer virtually nothing in the way of emotional or situational complexity. Mixed-Race Mixtape seeks to re-imagine how youth of color are represented in media by changing the conversation and offering positive alternative role models. We believe the show will spark important dialogue about these issues in many communities of color. 

The conversation about race in the US has been and is incomplete. Mixed-Race Mixtape fills in the gaps by tackling big questions through a personal point of view. Have you ever wondered...

  • What shapes our ideas of cultural and racial authenticity?
  • How do you navigate the historical power dynamics at play within mixed-raced identities?
  • How does this affect how we, as people of color, imagine claim and police our own identities?
  • How does this affect how white people imagine, claim and police the identities of people of color?

While Mixed-Race Mixtape is specifically about Latin@ identity, we believe it can also inspire wider conversations about similar issues in many communities of color. 

We want to have these conversations with everyone, but specifically young people of color and youth in general.

Mixed-Race Mixtape presents content that is accessible and engaging. Our tickets will also be accessible because we'll provide low-cost and free tickets at every performance. This show can be perform in a wide range of venues from community and cultural centers and schools to theatres, music halls and back yards. 

We will take the ideas and conversation sparked by the Mixed-Race Mixtape beyond the theatre doors by hosting post-show talkbacks, inviting local Hip-Hop artists to participate in our events and offering workshops about identity and creating art for social justice.

What We Can Accomplish With Your Support

Your support will go towards many, many, many vital elements of developing a performance piece for touring including, but not limited to: 

  • purchasing equipment
  • renting rehearsal and performance space
  • printing posters and merch
  • copyrighting and lawyers fees
  • paying artists, from graphic designers to musicians and technicians

We want to pay everyone involved in the project a living wage. Although our society often tells us it’s a luxury, we believe art is a vital part of all our lives. By funding this project, you are not only supporting the development of an important and relevant show, you are also saying you believe artists deserve a financially sustainable career path. You can be sure we’re putting it to good use. 

Message From The Writer:

Growing up as a mixed-Latino, I have struggled through many confusing, uncomfortable and alienating experiences–never sure where I fit, even when I knew where I wanted to fit. It has taken me 23 years to begin understanding these experiences and to express my growth through them all.

The last year and a half I have dug deep, unburied memories that were meant to be kept in the ground–discovered dirt lodged into my finger nails, still warm from my childhood–hands full, with my roots again. Mixed-Race Mixtape is the result of my explorations. My chance to re-plant and continue to grow. My honest, un-apologetic and vulnerable story through the only form I feel comfortable enough to share it in: Hip-Hop.

I pray for sun and water so I can share it with you all.

Other Ways To Help

If you can't contribute financially, don't worry! There are many other ways you can help Mixed-Race Mixtape be a success!

  • Share on social media. Share by word-of-mouth. Share via email. Share, share, share, share, share.
  • Connect us with your city/community center/college/theatre to see if they can bring us to perform!
  • Donate your time! Contact us for more info. 
  • Sign up for our e-list so you can stay up-to-date on our development!
  • Connect us to an arts patron who'd be interested in donating.


Meet The Team

Andrew J. Figueroa (Writer, Performer) better known by “Fig,” is an up and coming Hip-Hop artist, theatre maker and arts educator originally from Southern California. With a Mexican father and British mother, he is the first US-born member of the household and the younger of two. He is a recent graduate of Hampshire College, where he earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Latin@ Studies, and Performance through Theatre and Hip-Hop. His art strives to challenge how society engages with traditional theatre spaces and to open dialogue around how we can re-imagine the stage to include historically marginalized communities through a critical Hip-Hop lens. His work aims to exist as an agent of educational and social change directed at youth (specifically youth of color) by tapping into the influence Hip-Hop has on US culture and young people. Andrew wants to create work that is accessible, entertaining and political.

Allison Smartt (Production Manager, Head Designer) is the owner of Smartt Productions, LLC, a production company specializing in developing and promoting contemporary, gripping and social justice-oriented performance. Smartt Productions has a strong track record of producing financially sustainable and engaging performance. The company’s rep includes nationally acclaimed solo-show, MOM BABY GOD. She has built her reputation as a skilled organizer and facilitator at such respected institutions as Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, Barrington Stage Company, the Five College Dance Department and MAYO Center for the Arts. As a designer, her credits run the gamut of theatre and dance and include Tryst (Chester Theatre Company), Take it Over (The Club at La MaMa), The 10x10 New Play Festival (Barrington Stage Company),Forsenga (Arts in Odd Places Festival, NYC) and Hairspray (Hartford Children's Theatre). She is a proud member of and Political Action Coordinator for I.A.T.S.E #232 (International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees). She is an alumna of Hampshire College, where she concentrated in Immersive, Design Driven Performance.

Mtali William Banda (Musical Director) is a writer and jazz saxophonist. Since an early age, Mtali has had the privilege of performing with a lot of great artists from diverse musical backgrounds and from all over the world. He is a recent graduate of University of Massachusetts Amherst, where he studied Black Studies and Jazz performance. Mtali is also the founder of the social justice blog, Soul Latte, which features writings revolving around progressive politics, race, and culture. He also is a senior editor at ProfoundlyHuman.com, where he writes about culture and spirituality. Whether it be music or writing, all of Mtali’s work is based on one principle: the oneness of mankind, and how that message can be best spread.

Jorrell Watkins (Artistic Director) is an interdisciplinary artist integrating aesthetics of Shotokan Karate and West African Dance into theatrical performances of poetry. Most of Jorrell's work is contextualized through a historical framework that serves to bridge the gaps between written history and collective memory. Jorrell's education and experience background includes: B.A. from Hampshire College, certified conflict resolution trainer, national slam poet and three-year practitioner of Shotokan Karate and West African Dance.

Reed Sutherland (Bassist/Graphic Designer) At the core, Reed is driven by the act of creating art with others. Inclusive, and cooperative teamwork within the scope of artistic mediums is a model for not only human success, but a way in which to understand our own existence. Being in a creative environment with others is where Reed finds comfort and happiness. During his stay at Westfield State University he had the pleasure of studying with very bright and open minded professors that guided him through years of art history and visual thinking, taking from them not a list of names and dates, but of logical processes and workflows. Reed was teaching himself the bass guitar and applying the lessons he learned in the Art classroom to the bandstand. Building an education in Graphic Design, along with his own perspective and understanding of the world around him to share with others. After acquiring an internship at Northfire Recording Studio in Amherst Massachusetts, Reed was changed for good. Committed to the idea of being a good team member and resource for bands and artists, Reed brings a set of open eyes and ears for anyone willing to work together to achieve one goal. . . Create.

He is a recent graduate of Hampshire College, where he earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Latin@ Studies, and Performance through Theatre and Hip-Hop. His art strives to challenge how society engages with traditional theatre spaces and to open dialogue around how we can re-imagine the stage to include historically marginalized communities through a critical Hip-Hop lens. His work aims to exist as an agent of educational and social change directed at youth (specifically youth of color) by tapping into the influence Hip-Hop has on US culture and young people. Andrew wants to create work that is accessible, entertaining and political.


Allison Smartt (Production Manager, Head Designer) is the owner of Smartt Productions, LLC, a production company specializing in developing and promoting contemporary, gripping and social justice-oriented performance. Smartt Productions has a strong track record of producing financially sustainable and engaging performance. The company’s rep includes nationally acclaimed solo-show, MOM BABY GOD. She has built her reputation as a skilled organizer and facilitator at such respected institutions as Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival, Barrington Stage Company, the Five College Dance Department and MAYO Center for the Arts. As a designer, her credits run the gamut of theatre and dance and include Tryst (Chester Theatre Company), Take it Over (The Club at La MaMa), The 10x10 New Play Festival (Barrington Stage Company),Forsenga (Arts in Odd Places Festival, NYC) and Hairspray (Hartford Children's Theatre). She is a proud member of and Political Action Coordinator for I.A.T.S.E #232 (International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees). She is an alumna of Hampshire College, where she concentrated in Immersive, Design Driven Performance.

Mtali William Banda (Musical Director) is a writer and jazz saxophonist. Since an early age, Mtali has had the privilege of performing with a lot of great artists from diverse musical backgrounds and from all over the world. He is a recent graduate of University of Massachusetts Amherst, where he studied Black Studies and Jazz performance. Mtali is also the founder of the social justice blog, Soul Latte, which features writings revolving around progressive politics, race, and culture. He also is a senior editor at ProfoundlyHuman.com, where he writes about culture and spirituality. Whether it be music or writing, all of Mtali’s work is based on one principle: the oneness of mankind, and how that message can be best spread. 
Jorrell Watkins (Artistic Director) is an interdisciplinary artist integrating aesthetics of Shotokan Karate and West African Dance into theatrical performances of poetry. Most of Jorrell's work is contextualized through a historical framework that serves to bridge the gaps between written history and collective memory. Jorrell's education and experience background includes: B.A. from Hampshire College, certified conflict resolution trainer, national slam poet and three-year practitioner of Shotokan Karate and West African Dance.


Reed Sutherland (Bassist/Graphic Designer) At the core, Reed is driven by the act of creating art with others. Inclusive, and cooperative teamwork within the scope of artistic mediums is a model for not only human success, but a way in which to understand our own existence. Being in a creative environment with others is where Reed finds comfort and happiness. During his stay at Westfield State University he had the pleasure of studying with very bright and open minded professors that guided him through years of art history and visual thinking, taking from them not a list of names and dates, but of logical processes and workflows. Reed was teaching himself the bass guitar and applying the lessons he learned in the Art classroom to the bandstand. Building an education in Graphic Design, along with his own perspective and understanding of the world around him to share with others. After acquiring an internship at Northfire Recording Studio in Amherst Massachusetts, Reed was changed for good. Committed to the idea of being a good team member and resource for bands and artists, Reed brings a set of open eyes and ears for anyone willing to work together to achieve one goal. . . Create.

story:
10 dancers. 6 choreographers. 3 weeks. 2 performances. 1 great city.

Traverse City Dance Project 2015 

We are back for another amazing season! 


The Traverse City Dance Project brings thrilling performances of cutting-edge professional DANCE to Northern Michigan. We also: 

  • Provide professional dancers with summer employment
  • Offer emerging and established choreographers a chance to make their very best work in an inspiring, healthy environment
  • Offer apprenticeships to pre-professional dancers 

 This season, we are creating a series of exciting new works with professional ballet dancers from around the country. PLUS, we are staging Delicate Balance, a stunning contemporary ballet by internationally-renowned choreographer Jodie Gates! 


Help us raise $5000, and bring this season to life! 

We will accomplish so much with these funds! The Traverse City Dance Project is a progressive, economical, and sustainable way to make new, adventurous dance. Your support of our 2015 season will go towards:
  • Housing, travel, and a stipend for 10 professional dancers and 6 choreographers.
  • Rental of theater space at Milliken Auditorium (your donation goes back into the community of Traverse City!)
  • Costumes 
  • Lighting design
  • Live music 
  • Marketing to local media outlets
  • Programs (printed locally)

Perks? We have some great ones! 

  • A valuable tax deduction through Fractured Atlas, our fiscal sponsor
  • Weekly video updates, including rehearsal footage & interviews with dancers, choreographers & musicians
  • Limited-edition TCDP T-shirt
  • Sponsor a Dancer - this popular perk is back! Your sponsorship enables one professional dancer to participate in the TCDP. These dancers are eagerly waiting in the wings - your sponsorship brings them to Traverse City and to the stage! 
  • Sponsor a Ballet - Produce one of the dance works of our 2014 season, and you will receive special thanks in our program, get exclusive invitations to rehearsals, and VIP tickets to your choice of show. Limited to one producer per piece.

We think you know what the biggest perk is - the joy of supporting dance, and the community of people who make it happen. Be part of our community - we look forward to making dance with you!

story:
The Story

15 year old Oliver Tate is torn between rescuing his parents’ slowly deteriorating relationship and luring pyromaniac girlfriend Jordana Bevan into falling in love with him and falling into bed with him. With Graham (his mother’s mystic ex) moving in next door and his father’s unending wrestle with depression, Oliver is left with only an advanced vocabulary and near total self-belief. Losing his virginity or saving his parents’ marriage? Which will prove more important? 

The show previewed at the Alma Tavern in Bristol, and we received five star reviews, as well as positive feedback from the author of the original novel.

Reviews

“Sweet, playful and thoroughly entertaining.”

★★★★★ Epigram

http://epigram.org.uk/arts/2015/02/popcorn-productions-submarine-review

“A hugely entertaining and memorable production.”

★★★★★ Inter:Mission

http://www.intermissionbristol.co.uk/2015/02/03...

Popcorn.JSB - The Company

The company is made up of over thirty members of which eighteen will be travelling to the Fringe.  We are lucky enough to have collaborated with musicians in Brighton and London to create a fully original soundtrack for the show. As companies for the Fringe go, we are most certainly one of its largest. This is simply because one of the most important values at the crux of the foundation of Popcorn Productions is to give as many people as many opportunities as we can.

Given the family-orientated and touching nature of the show, we are extremely hopeful about the show's success at the Festival. With a successful Fringe run to our name, we will then be respected as a company with a considerable amount of experience and knowledge which will allow us to be able to help others reach their goals. Cliche as it may sound, we really want this company to be a forum in which we can facilitate the dreams of other people. We want to run outreach programmes both in the UK as well as in developing countries with children who just need a little encouragement and support in widening their creative abilities and using that to help them in situations in which they find themselves. But we can't do that without establishing ourselves as a company to be reckoned with, and our first step in that direction is to take Edinburgh by storm at the Fringe Festival this summer.

Money Matters

Please see the pie chart in our "images" for a  breakdown of where the money raised will be spent. Any extra money earned will go into the contingency which will support the day to day running costs of the show. 

Visuals

For those of you who are familiar with the movie, you will know that Oliver Tate creates a short film of his two-week-strong relationship with Jordana Bevan. In our adaptation, we've recreated the rose tinted super-8 footage through the idealised perspective of Oliver's somewhat overactive imagination. To watch our version of "Two Weeks of Love-Making" click on the link below.

https://vimeo.com/125580967

Any Questions?

If you have any further questions please do not hesitate to contact us at:

  popcornjsb@outlook.com

If you would like your donation to be acknowledged, please let us know and we are more than happy to do so. Otherwise, all donations will be anonymously thanked in the programme.

story:
I currently live with my mum in Darlington, she is recently divorced, recovering from breast cancer and working part time. She works hard to ensure that I can continue my education. We have been through a lot this year and even though things have been very hard for us, I am amazed at her resolve and commitment.

I have been lucky enough to have been offered a 1 year performing arts foundation course at Cambridge Performing Arts at Bodywork Company Dance Studios. This course will hopefully lead on to a degree in musical theatre.

My dream is to perform in the West End and then to open my own performing arts company or school. To do this I need to continue my training to graduate level.

I am seeking support because foundation courses are not funded through the colleges and I know that my mum is not able to cover the year's costs, even though she would try.

With enough funding, it would mean that something that I have dreamed of, all my life, is another step closer to becoming a reality.

It means that I can put everything into my training without worrying about course fees or having to find work with enough hours to cover fees, but leaving enough time for training, and hopefully my mum won't have to stress herself out or wear herself out trying to raise the funds to help me get to college by herself.

Becoming a performer is the only thing that I can remember ever wanting to be.

story:
Short Summary

Youth Ensemble Theatre Inc. (Y.E.T.i.)  is a theatre production company created to give youth the opportunity to experience and explore all aspects of professional theatre. Founded in January of 2015, Y.E.T.i. members are involved in everything from marketing and event planning, to production and reaching out to the community. As an ensemble, our goals include:

  • Collaborating in order to create real, professional level performances from the new and diverse perspectives of youth
  • Exceeding people's expectations of our abilities in order to provide the community with new, unique experiences when it comes to theatre
  • Breaking the barrier between youth and professional theatre
Overall we are very excited about the potential and opportunities given to us through this program and are looking for your support to make it a success!

What We Need & What You Get

Currently our goal is to raise at least $2000. With the current budget, raising this much money should guarantee that the show be put on to its fullest potential. There are also many perks to donating through this website, including:
  • Signed Playbills
  • Comp Tickets
  • Backstage Tours and more!
Since these perks are limited in availability, its best to donate as soon as possible! While they are limited in availability, any and all donations made are greatly appreciated.
The Impact

To all of the members of Y.E.T.i. as well as many Childsplay staff members, this campaign is incredibly important. At the start, everyone was extremely excited to receive the opportunity to both participate and start this program. We have many hopes for the future of this company and with your help, those hopes can be made into a reality. This is our opportunity to see what it really takes to produce a show along with run a company in the theatre business. Support us in order to keep this company alive!

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks when it comes to fundraising. When it comes to online crowd-funding, there can be even more of a challenge. Rest assured, any and all funds that are raised through this campaign will be used to the fullest to put on the best production that we can make. The main challenge that this company will face is time. Our show dates are already fast approaching so in order to make everything possible, we need as much support as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

While we understand that not everyone can contribute, there are a multitude of other ways that you can help. Make sure to check out all of our social media pages to keep up to date on any other fundraising events that we may be organizing and volunteer opportunities. Also try and spread the word as much as possible! Word of mouth is some of the best advertising that we can get so please tell everyone you know. Also, remember that the Indiegogo comes built with tools that you can use to share this page. Overall, we will be thankful for any support that you are able to give, be it monetary or not.

story:
Scratch. It's a matter of lice and death.

ABOUT THEATRE PLEXUS

We’re a Vancouver-based independent theatre company. Founded in 2013, we tell intimate stories in small spaces that hit us in those tender places. Our projects are often female-focused and Canadian, and our next project SCRATCH by Charlotte Corbeil-Coleman, is no exception. Help us bring this heartwarming play to the stage!

ABOUT SCRATCH

Scratch is a moving and candid tale about grief from all angles. Told through the eyes of teenaged daughter Anna with assistance from her best friend, father, mother, aunt, and some guy who calls himself the poet, Scratch is a story about growing up, losing a loved one, and dealing with a raging case of head lice. Simultaneously.

Our production, happening at Havana Theatre from Jun 4-13, 2015, features some of Vancouver's most exciting emerging and established talent including Eileen Barrett, Tamara McCarthy, Caitlin McCarthy, Stephanie Izsak and Markian Tarasiuk.

HOW YOUR DONATION WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE

Aside from supporting Canadian talent and a play that easily passes the Bechdel Test (http://bechdeltest.com), your contribution will go very far in supporting the necessary costs of our production. We are operating as an Equity Artist Collective and have a very minimal budget. As much as we are trying to keep our expenses low, however, it still costs money to make great theatre! Here's where the money we hope to raise with this campaign is going:

$2800 for Venue Rental

$450 for Rehearsal Space

$575 for Set/Costumes/Props

$175 for Artist Fees

BUT WAIT! THERE'S MORE!

Theatre Plexus believes in giving back to the community. For this production of Scratch, we are partnering with the Living Through Loss Counselling Society of BC to raise money for the Judy Capes Memorial Fund. The money collected during the run will go directly to providing counselling and group therapy support to women at risk.

For more info visit: http://www.ltlc.bc.ca/

We need YOUR HELP to make all of this a reality!

Scratch by Charlotte Corbeil-Coleman

Presented at the Havana Theatre

June 4-13

8pm Tuesday-Saturday/2pm Matinee Saturdays/Sunday

Written by Charlotte Corbeil-Coleman

Directed by Genevieve Fleming

*Presented in Partnership with Living Through Loss Counselling Society of BC*

Tickets $18/ Matinee $10

For tickets visit: http://scratch.brownpapertickets.com

story:
Wrestling with the WIP is a full-length, dance theatre performance comprised of several vignettes inspired by the process of quilt-making: fragmentation, repurposing, and (re)arranging,  to describe my, as well as the contributing artists',  journey of self-discovery, awareness and agency.  It was first performed in the Fall Thesis Concert at the University of Maryland in October 2014, and I am thrilled to have the chance to perform this work again at the Cafritz Foundation Theatre at Dance Place  for the Capital Fringe Festival this coming July.

In its original incarnation, I had full university support.  I changed the performance space to suit my needs; I had Lighting, Sound and Scenic Designers assigned to me; I had the privilege of designing my costumes and someone else had to do the actual sewing; the university even paid the artists' and licensing fees.  As a production, it was a complete luxury and so completely the opposite reality.  

In this latest incarnation, I am truly lucky to not only have most of the artists and designers back, but I also have the costumes!  However, we are not allowed to alter Dance Place to suit our needs, which means we will alter the set design and the dance itself to fit Dance Place.  The performance will become an immersive experience taking place not just on stage, but in the lobby, amongst the audience, and in secluded alcoves.

As it is my first foray into the world of the self-producing artist, it's equal parts exciting and terrifying, but I can't do it alone.  The performing artists, designers, the stage crew, the house staff, and YOU will make these performances in Capital Fringe happen.  You can help by giving up your Starbucks for 1 day and donate $5.  You can certainly give more if you are willing and able (and there are perks if you do!), but if everyone pitches in $5, the dancers, designers and I can get this show on the road!

story:
Accidental Shakespeare Company and the Hit & Run Shakespeare series ARE BACK!! We’ve got an awesome new admin team, a brand new website, and re-branding that embraces the pop-up, speakeasy nature of Hit & Run!


Accidental Shakespeare Company was founded four years ago with the mission to bring playful productions of classic works to the New York Shakespeare Community.


We became most well-known for our Hit & Run Shakespeare series, which produced 14 productions in just three years. Hit & Run Shakespeare is a one night only theatrical event with NO rehearsal and NO director -- just pure, spontaneous PLAY! 


What does that mean? Actors show up memorized and with character choices all their own. The audience brings the props, and we put on a fully staged show, completely on the fly! A referee judges the event, blowing a whistle every time an actor fucks up and tallying it on the Foul Board. What results is a level of spontaneity, creativity, and TRUTH on stage like you've never seen before. 


After being closed for seven months, we need your help to restart the Hit & Run series. Please consider donating (check out our perks on the right!), or if you are financially unable, please consider supporting us by sharing this campaign with others. 


WHAT YOUR MONEY BUYS:


- Venue 

- Insurance

- Wine

- Printing Scripts and Programs

- New Books of Shame and Sandwich Boards

- Website Design and Maintenance

- Paying our Actors and Team

- Filing for LLC


Accidental means the world to me. Not only is it the kind of live, spontaneous theater that inspires and engages me, but it is also a community, a gym where actors can work out, a playground for creative thinking, a home. So thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping to bring this amazing series back to life. 


PLAY ON!


Sincerely,

Kim Wong

Artistic Director
story_txt: Accidental Shakespeare Company and the Hit & Run Shakespeare series ARE BACK!! We’ve got an awesome new admin team, a brand new website, and re-branding that embraces the pop-up, speakeasy nature of Hit & Run!Accidental Shakespeare Company was founded four years ago with the mission to bring playful productions of classic works to the New York Shakespeare Community.We became most well-known for our Hit & Run Shakespeare series, which produced 14 productions in just three years. Hit & Run Shakespeare is a one night only theatrical event with NO rehearsal and NO director -- just pure, spontaneous PLAY! What does that mean? Actors show up memorized and with character choices all their own. The audience brings the props, and we put on a fully staged show, completely on the fly! A referee judges the event, blowing a whistle every time an actor fucks up and tallying it on the Foul Board. What results is a level of spontaneity, creativity, and TRUTH on stage like you've never seen before. After being closed for seven months, we need your help to restart the Hit & Run series. Please consider donating (check out our perks on the right!), or if you are financially unable, please consider supporting us by sharing this campaign with others. WHAT YOUR MONEY BUYS:- Venue - Insurance- Wine- Printing Scripts and Programs- New Books of Shame and Sandwich Boards- Website Design and Maintenance- Paying our Actors and Team- Filing for LLCAccidental means the world to me. Not only is it the kind of live, spontaneous theater that inspires and engages me, but it is also a community, a gym where actors can work out, a playground for creative thinking, a home. So thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping to bring this amazing series back to life. PLAY ON!Sincerely,Kim WongArtistic Director

story:
Short Summary

Branson Missouri is a town of opportunity and talent, surrounded by a lush and beautiful mountainous country and the consider the central hive of entertainment in South West Missouri. From country music, to comedy and murder mysteries, the town boasts a great deal of entertainment and activities for the tourists. But our intent is to make a show that all the family can enjoy and bring their children to and something adults can enjoy as well. An interactive comedy that changes every month and encourages imagination, interaction and the geek culture. In this the NJ4K Matinée Comedy Theatre proudly presents, "Meet the Ravens", a comedy inspired by the Addams Family and The Munsters, live on stage. We will also be producing three other productions throughout the year, starting with Sherlock Holmes in the Spring, Adam Atom in the Summer and our Nevermore Christmas special.

           

What you will us help create is a totally new experience for Branson where your family can enjoy a fully entertaining experience and interact with it directly. Heckle the show, be invited on stage, dress up as a character from a comic book or film and win prizes. A show perfectly suitable for geeks and people of all ages and walks of life. And audio/visual experience consisting of film live performance and more importantly, a contributing audience.

The Cast and Crew

We are all experienced actors and stage hands some of us going back with 25 years of stage experience and acting, some of us as young as 10 to 45. We have had experience in all fields from the Rocky Horror Show, Shakespeare and the local Audio and Visual productions of Jonah here in Branson. Our hands on experience is second to none and our drive for perfection and to entertain is just as insatiable. We all have a lot of love for our art, and the talent we have procured is utterly amazing. All of whom have bright futures ahead of them and we are proud to have them aboard.

What We Need

A new show is always a challenge, from it's conception to it's eventual premier. Our show is intended to go through the year of 2015 and follow on again in 2016, but the start is always the first hurdle. We need at least $3,500 to get the show of the road, this includes funding for the theater itself, the props, costume and the technical aspects of the show from sound to the video and stage effects. Budget is always an issue, but at the very least this is the number we need to create something really enjoyable for the Branson crowd and the tourists. If we at least reach our 45% goal we can guarantee the theater and the audio visual elements are in place and we will have the show we envision, but the goal is vitally important to make it truly work. Some may ask how one can start a show on such a low budget, and it's easy when the producer himself is a visual effects coordinator and is more interested in getting the show of the ground than paid for his initial work. It's the show that will make or break the team, not the initial build up. We have three venues in mind for the show, but we cannot announce those until we get the official go ahead from said theaters. That said we are focusing on the route 76 strip in Branson for full impact.

Our most important need right now is a projector for our screen for one. Our intent is to make this a fully visual production, extending our sets into a virtual background, giving you an in depth feeling of interaction. Imagine if you will, Sherlock at the train station, people interacting in the background and an entire train comes on to the set upon which Sherlock and Watson board and the train leaves the stage in it's full glory. This is the four dimensional world we want to bring to you.

Also we need skin mics for sound. Audio is by far the most important aspect of our show, and with your support we will have the money needed to create a professional production with quality visual and sound elements that you deserve.

What You Get

Can't have a fund raiser without the perks now can we? It's important to us to make you feel a part of something wonderful and your contribution to this production is valued greatly. By checking our perks you find everything from the obligatory thanks, the standard T-Shirt to more unique one of a kind perks you won't get anywhere else. The perks you will find are as unique as the show we are creating and will be something you will treasure, we hope, for years to come.

The Impact

Branson is a wonderful city, so full of untapped talent and potential, it is a popular town that can go much further if it moves on to more exciting and unique things, whilst at the same time holding onto it's core values and the shows that made it what it is today. This show is about Branson as a whole, not just the 76 strip or the Landing, but everything about it and it's surrounding areas. With beautiful vistas, untapped spots to enjoy, boating, fishing, country walks, malls, entertainment, eating and activities, you will find as we perform this show that we shall open your eyes to many levels of Branson you may not have considered visiting before now.

Also this show will create an experience for your family. Something the kids will enjoy if they get too bored of golfing, or swimming. We encourage cosplay and dress up and will offer prizes to the best of the show every evening. As well as activity packs for the children to enjoy and use to take part in during the show. Our intent is make this show as interactive and as audience friendly as possible. Branson being the venue of the every growing Visioncon, a comicbook convention held at the Radisson Motel every year, the Matinée Comedy Theatre will definitely appeal to geeks and nostalgic hearts alike.

Risks & Challenges

Starting a new show is always a risk, which is why we have asked for such a small amount to get us started. The risks are obvious so our tactic is to get us out there through as many means as possible. We have three venues in mind, and a forth in the works. Out strategy is to spread our show through Branson to get established, giving the population a choice of three shows to choose from. We have also been offered smaller venues to promote our show to families and children alike, so we are in for a busy year. But we intend to make it as entertaining as possible for all involved. Our intent is one way or another, everyone who lives, visits, or works in Branson will know who we are, and what we do. We are proud to have received support from many of the local shows already and many local big names who seen and appreciate the need for a new show such as this. Getting out there and known is not so much a challenge as it is to be heard, so determination and advertising is going to be a wonderful and interesting challenge for us, and our producer sells adverting so that is our ace in the hole.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize not everyone can contribute financially, but we do need your help to get the word out there. We have allowed for 30 days to raise the funds we need to get started, but a campaign alone is useless without your support. We ask that you get the word out, support us, use your social media, word of mouth anything you can to make this campaign a success, not only for the show but for a new experience in Branson. Thank you for taking your time to read our campiagn.
