story:
THE SETTING

The House of Bernarda Alba (Spanish: La casa de Bernarda Alba) is a play by the Spanish dramatist Federico Garcia Lorca. Commentators have often grouped it with Blood Wedding and Yerma as a "rural trilogy". Lorca did not include it in his plan for a "trilogy of the Spanish earth" (which remained unfinished at the time of his murder).

Lorca described the play in its subtitle as a drama of women in the villages of Spain. The House of Bernarda Alba was Lorca's last play, completed on 19 June 1936, two months before Lorca's death during the Spanish Civil War. The play was first performed in 1945. The play centers on the events of a house in Andalusia during a period of mourning, in which Bernarda Alba, her five daughters and the housekeeper also live there.

The deliberate exclusion of any male character from the action helps build up the high level of sexual tension that is present throughout the play. Pepe "el Romano", the love interest of Bernarda's daughters and suitor of Angustias, never appears on stage. The play explores themes of repression, passion, and conformity, and inspects the effects of men upon women.


ABOUT THE PROJECT

Our inspiration: "The House of Bernarda Alba" by Federico Garcia Lorca.

Our materials: Cinema, Theater, Dance, Music and visual arts.
Our Objective: Performance of a final aesthetic condition.

Seven women placed in a stage installation. This "new style" enclosure activates their memory.

Bernarda Alba and her daughters converse with their filmed version of a mixed media performance.

Relationships are mechanically reproduced through repetition leading to conflict and conflict leads to repression.


Our plan is to stage the show at the main scene of the Neos Kosmos Theater.

5 shows a week for 6 consecutive weeks, between the 15th of April and the 31st of May 2015.


THE ARTISTS

Concept: Yannis Tsortekis, Stavros Gasparatos

Dramaturgy/Direction: Yannis Tsortekis

Music: Stavros Gasparatos

Choreography: Nancy Stamatopoulou

Set Design: Yannis Arvanitis

Cinematography: Diamantis Karanastasis

Lighting Design: Sakis Birbilis

Makeup : Ioanna Symeonidi

Assistant director: Alexia Yiannopoulou

Assistant Dramaturg: Andreas Andreadis

Actors: Domna Zafiropoulou, Eleftheria Roussaki, Ioanna Piata, Eleni Fortossi, Irini Tsatov, Fani Apostolidou, Elena Arvaniti.

Translation from Spanish: Polykseni Stavrou

--

Yannis Tsortekis is an actor and a director, who has been involved in a multitude of both theatrical and movie productions. He is a graduate of both the School of Dramatic Art of the National Theatre (with honors ) and of the Department of Theatre Studies, University of Patras.
He is a founding member of the Theatre Society 'Rosemary On Top Of The Hills', as well as that of the Independent Arts Council I.AR.C.
He has been nominated twice for the ‘Dimitris Horn' award for his performance in the plays ‘Crime and Punishment’ and ‘The Caretaker’ and has been a candidate for the ‘Karolos Koun’ award for his performance in the play ‘Seven reasonable responses'.
He has received acting awards from the 48 hour film project - Athens 2009, the 48HFP International film festival of Las Vegas, as well as a ‘Karolos Koun’ praise in 2009 for his performance in a modern Greek work, entitled 'Black serenity' that he directed.
Since 2010 he organizes seminars under the title 'Notes and references for dramaturgy and interpretation' and teaches at the Drama School of the Regional Theatre in Patra.

--
Stavros Gasparatos is a composer and sound artist. He mainly composes music for dance, theatre and cinema, but he is also frequently working on solo projects.
His music has been performed in all major Greek theaters and concert venues (including the ancient Epidaurus theatre, the Onassis Cultural Centre, the Megaron Concert Hall, etc) and also in London, Macao, Napoly, Berlin, Toronto, Sofia, Amsterdam, Paris and New York. He is a frequent collaborator of the National Greek Theatre.
He has composed music for over 100 productions (Theater – Cinema – Dance) and he is considered as one of the most important and prolific composers of the new Greek generation as well as a brilliant musician and virtuoso performer.


TO SUPPORT US

Your valuable contribution will be used to cover the set construction costs and the creation of the visual and audio material. If you can't contribute, please use the Indiegogo share tools get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.


THE COSTS

Construction of stage setting: € 5,000 

Theatre Operating Costs: € 4,200

Videos (shooting and editing):  € 1,500

Music and Sound Environment (production costs): € 1,000

Costume Construction: € 1,500

Makeup Materials: € 800

Video projector: € 1,000

Total: € 14,000

story:
Happy Birthday Giwa...

Happy Birthday Giwa...

Happy Birthdaaaaaay!!!

 

GIWAYEN MATA IS ELATED to be celebrating 22 years of perseverance, love, music, song, and dance with you! It's because of supporters like you, that we are able to study, teach, create, and perform original works for the community.

Join the 2015 Fundraising Party Campaign TODAY!

GIWAYEN MATA, is Atlanta’s own award-winning, all-sistah dance, percussion,
and vocal ensemble. Performing dynamic and soul-stirring issue oriented work
from the diaspora, Giwayen Mata educates audiences about matters pertaining to
people of color, women, and the environment. For over twenty years Giwayen Mata
has been performing their original pieces that have reached and touched
audiences around the globe.  Click here to read more about the company and the powerful work Giwayen Mata is doing worldwide. 

 

Your contributions help us to build a legacy of creativity, authenticity, and
community...

The creative works of Giwayen Mata are made possible by working with world renowned artists like Baba Chuck Davis, Marie Bass-Wiles, Ron K. Brown (Evidence), Assane Konte (KanKouran) and many others!

                        

 

Your contributions help us to teach the next generation of dancers, drummers, and community builders...

                            

Giwayen Mata provides cultural arts performances, workshops and classes that bring audiences to their feet hungry for more. Our classes in the schools and the community enrich the lives of young and old through camps and outreach programs such as Mo’ Motion and Community ArtReach Program of Excellence.

Our annual concert and high energy classes are our pledge to the community made possible by your donations.

We are able to continue to develop and expand our programs through donations large and small. Your contributions are tax deductible and are much appreciated.

By donating to this campaign, Giwayen Mata will be able to continue to do the following: 

  • Develop youth talent by offering workshops and master classes to young people
  • Perform locally and throughout the nation 
  • Impact the world through international work
  • Provide educational opportunities and work for dancers 

  • Educate audiences about the African Diaspora 

                               HURRY!

DONATE NOW TO RECEIVE YOUR PARTY FAVORS!


In celebration of our birthday/anniversary we want to give you a token of our appreciation for your support. Choose your support level and receive one or more of these fun party favors (aka perks*):  

  • Dance Class Passes
  • Giwayen Mata Merchandise
  • Concert Tickets
  • and more.....  

*Perks are subject to change and are limited to availability.

      Invite others to the party!!!

Giwayen Mata wants to thank you in advance for your support. As we continue
our new year of programs, classes, and concerts, we are counting on the
charitable giving of our individual supporters to help us continue to produce
dynamic and impactful work. We are asking that you not only show your support
by making a generous contribution, but also by sharing this page with others
and introducing the work of Giwayen Mata to new audiences. This is the season
to be thankful and we thank you in advance for your support!


                       

              THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Hi! 

We're Arch 468 - a small theatre company based in Brixton.

This June, we're taking our production of Cuddles to New York for an Off-Broadway run.

Cuddles is a brilliant award winning play by Joseph Wilde. In 2013 it had a sold-out run at Ovalhouse in London. Audiences and Critics loved it  and now we’re taking it on a national tour this spring before transferring to 59E59 Theatres in New York. 

…a smart and gruesome gothic tale that reveals Wilde as a writer with a great deal of confidence and nerve.”  ★★★★ Timeout

We are SO EXCITED. We can’t wait to take a bite of the big apple. 

We’re a little company, with big ambition - and for us, the New York transfer is a huge opportunity to show our work internationally for the first time. 

By backing our campaign, you’ll be playing an incredibly important part in making our dreams of a New York transfer come true and helping us take the first step in world domination!

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve already raised more than £40,000 towards the costs of the tour and transfer and we're using this campaign to secure the last £3000 we need to make it all happen.

The money you give us will pay for flights and decent accommodation in New York for the team while they're working on the show. Return flights cost around £600 per person and rents in New York are some of the most expensive in the world. 

As well as the fuzzy glow you'll get from backing a brilliant and innovative team, you'll also get  exclusive goodies that aren't availlable anywhere else: from signed production shots, posters, first editions of the script and tickets to the show to jars of homemade jam. For the really generous folks, we’re offering press night tickets, access to special events, dinner with our team and a VIP drinks reception.

The Impact

This is a really big deal for us and we want you to share in our excitement! By taking Cuddles to New York, we'll get to show our work internationally for the first time. It's a vital chance to grow the company beyond the small scale theatres we're used to and start building a new audience in the US. If Cuddles is successful, we plan that it'll be the first of many transatlantic productions, collaborations and commissions. 

Although we're a small company, we've built a strong reputation in the UK for making brilliant, trail blazing theatre and have a strong track record of producing sell-out shows that audiences love. With you behind us, we can take our brand of edgy new theatre to an international audience, and who knows, before too long you might be able to watch us on Broadway and know that it's all thanks to you!

Other Ways You Can Help

As well as backing the campaign, please take a moment to share the message to a wider audience;

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, twitter and other social media to help us reach as many people as possible
  • Tell your friends about the campaign and the show
  • Come and see the show on tour! You can find out more here.

Thanks so much for reading this far - and if you can, please don't forget to click the button to contribute!

We're Arch 468 - a small theatre company based in Brixton.
This June, we're taking our production of Cuddles to New York for an Off-Broadway run.


Cuddles is a brilliant award winning play by Joseph Wilde. In 2013 it had a sold-out run at Ovalhouse in London. Audiences and Critics loved it  and now we’re taking it on a national tour this spring before transferring to 59E59 Theatres in New York. 

…a smart and gruesome gothic tale that reveals Wilde as a writer with a great deal of confidence and nerve.”  ★★★★ Timeout

We are SO EXCITED. We can’t wait to take a bite of the big apple.

story:
What is Kidz Theater?

When Kristen Caesar, Artistic Director, began Kidz Theater in San Diego in the late 90s, she set out on a quest to provide performance opportunities for and make theater magic tangible to young performers. 

Kidz Theater, its performers, and its staff have now spanned two coasts and over two decades on a quest to find what each performer's brand of magic is.  With a passionate leader in Kristen and a love for the art form of musical theater in each person who comes to Kidz Theater, our quest to make magic tangible becomes more and more real for a new child every single day.

But we can't do it alone.

Magic Online

The COVID-19 Pandemic sent us fully online for over a year.  In the middle of auditions for our spring production of “Carousel” last March, we were forced to find a way to move the entire company’s mission to be able to provide the same home and opportunities we have afforded young performers for over 20 years to our computer screens.

COVID-19 has devastated the arts in New York City.  Broadway theaters remain dark.  Smaller companies have closed their doors forever.  We are still in the middle of a crisis that seems like it may never end.  But through that all, Kidz Theater’s mission has become even more important.  When the arts come back, the education we provide will be instrumental in breathing life into our new, post-pandemic world.

Why Should I Care?

Kidz Theater is one of the only educational theater programs in New York City that offers professional theater training at a low cost, and about 50% of our performers receive a scholarship. In addition to performance opportunities, we also train young technicians, stage managers, directors, and all of the disciplines it takes to bring a musical to life.

Our alumni are currently at musical theater programs across the country, and several are slated to resume touring or performing in their Broadway productions once theaters can resume normal operations.

Kidz Theater also provides a home for many kids and teens that need the space to grow and evolve as performers.  Our disappearance would cause the performing arts in New York City to suffer greatly.

How Do We Meet Our Goals?

Money is tight these days.  We know that now more than ever.  And with the arts on hold for a while, it may feel like your money is going nowhere.  That could not be further from the truth.

Each dollar provides a child or a teenager with an opportunity to learn and grow with our program.  This money goes into scholarships for those who need help affording tuition, so that we never have to turn someone away who wants to learn.  This money goes into making sure we have the materials, the time, the staff, and the space to shape our curriculum.  This money makes sure that we can provide the best quality education that we can.  This money helps us to approach the daunting task of preparing to re open live.

I'm SO Broke.  How Else Can I Help?

The best thing you can do is spread the word.  Share this campaign on your Twitter, or Insta, or Finsta, or wherever you can.  Call your friends and dictate the url to them out loud if you have to.  But word of mouth has always been first and foremost how Kidz Theater survives.

Also, we are always looking for the donations of goods/services to add to our incentives to donate.  If you can offer a 1-hour private lessons with yourself or any artists you’re connected with, signed Playbills, Signed Original Cast Recordings; anything that can enrich this campaign and the performers we know (and those we don't, yet!), that is a welcome service.

story:
Is it Your First Time? We'll be Gentle...

Theatre is an adventure, a plunge into the unknown. So are relationships. We’re producing a hilarious, heartbreaking new play about relationships. We’ve decided to plunge into the unknown, and take the play on the road. We want you to be a part of the adventure – to form a relationship that enriches artists and audiences alike.

The play is First Time Last Time, a romantic comedy by Scott Sharplin (more about him below). It’s a brand new production by Cape Breton artists. We’re producing it May 13-16 at the Highland Arts Theatre in Sydney – it’s gonna be great. Then, we want to hit the road and produce First Time Last Time in Toronto. It’s a big First Time for many of us, in a lot of ways.

Wanna hear about the play?

First Time Lust Time

Remember your first time? What if you could make it last forever?

Ben and Airlea have nothing in common except a mutual attraction. He’s a Bay B’y, she’s from the big, bad city. He trusts science; she follows the stars. He likes hockey and Jäger; she goes for vampire improv. Neither wants commitment. But when a no-strings fling goes supernova, the mismatched couple need to invent a whole new kind of relationship. “’Cause every time’s still a first time if you do it right.”

The result is a hilarious succession of first dates and last loves, filled with harmony and heartbreak, intimacy and revelation, romantic fancy and harsh reality. First Time Last Time is both a rollicking, raunchy comedy and a moving, personal drama about a one night stand that lasts a lifetime.

Shadow Theatre premiered the show this March in Edmonton, AB. Here’s what the critics said about the script:

“First Time Last Time has great lines, big laughs.” – Vue Weekly

“Sharplin’s writing, always artful, has a real comic crackle to it.” – Edmonton Journal

“Sharplin has a flair for comedy and writes elegant and witty dialogue between two people who at first seem incompatible but who work toward a new set of rules.” – Edmonton Sun

(When the reviews from our Sydney production come in after May 14, we'll post links here too!)

Wanna hear about our production?

East Time Last Time

Scott Sharplin studied playwriting at the National Theatre School, and has had scripts produced all across Canada, along with publications by Signature Editions, Athabasca University Press, and Playwrights Canada Press. Scott’s scripts have produced belly laughs from Cape Breton audiences before, in both the Cape Breton Stage Company’s production of ZomRomCom (2013) and in the Fortress of Louisbourg’s musical comedy, A Recipe for Love (2013). He also has more than 20 years’ directing experience, and he currently teaches playwriting and directing at Cape Breton University.

For his play’s Eastern Canadian premiere, Scott sought out two of the most talented and versatile performers in Cape Breton: Wesley J. Colford (Ben) and Jenna Lahey (Airlea). Wesley studied at Sheridan College and George Brown College. Since then he has split his time between Sydney and Toronto, where he has worked professionally and semi-professionally in a variety of disciplines with some of Canada’s leading artists. Sydney audiences will recognize him from HAT’s production of Punch Up, while Toronto crowds associate him with the company he co-founded, Aim for the Tangent Theatre.

Jenna Lahey has been an actor in Cape Breton since 2000, when she joined the Fortress of Louisbourg’s Murder Mystery plays. In 2010, she began performing elsewhere in the Cape Breton theatre scene, quickly becoming one of the busiest artists on the island. Some of her favourite roles include Annie in Oklahoma! (Boardmore, 2011), Theresa in In the Valley (CBSC, 2013), Roxane in Cyrano de Bergerac (Boardmore, 2014), and Goneril in King Lear (Bandshell, 2014). She is the recent winner of a Boardmore One-Act Festival award (Best Supporting Actress).

Together, these artists formed the Big Smokey Collective, an artists’ co-op designed to bring high-quality Cape Breton theatre to audiences off the island. First Time Last Time is our first venture, and for a play that’s all about a small-town kid finding love in the big city, where better to head than Toronto?

First Time Passe Time

A Caper co-op in T-Dot? Can they form a loving relationship with a city that’s been burned so many times before? Or will their First Time really be their Last Time? You’ get to decide!

The Toronto run of First Time Last Time is June 10-21, 2015. We’re in Theatre Passe Muraille’s Backspace, a terrific, intimate space in one of Toronto’s most historic theatre venues. The Big Smokey Collective is partnering with Aim for the Tangent Theatre, so we’ve got some friends on the ground when we arrive. But we need help to promote the play, so that Toronto audiences know what a rare opportunity they’ve got.

Here’s what we’ve already got covered (we’ve rounded these numbers off a bit to make them easier to read, but donors can request a more detailed breakdown any time!):

  • Rental Costs: $3,000 including insurance.
  • Travel Costs: $7,000 for gas, accommodations, and insurance on the road.
  • Production Costs: $1,500 for set, costumes, props, and technical needs (Capers know how to cut corners!).

Here’s where your contributions will go:

  • Publicity (Print) Costs: $1,500 for posters, handbills, and stickers.
  • Publicity (Electronic) Costs: $800 for a comprehensive social media campaign.
  • Cost Recovery: $300 to mail your gifts out to you in a timely fashion.
  • Per Diems: $2,400 for three starving artists to sink their teeth into T.O.

That last point may sound frivolous, but it’s all we’re expecting in terms of payment for this show. Our projected box office and our other fundraising sources allow us to break even, but we’re not after riches, we want to get enriched. Those per diems will let us explore Toronto’s own arts scene, and to network and create future partnerships with local artists. In short, your support will help us to ensure that Big Smokey’s First Time is not our Last Time.

Perk Time Last Time

Because our play is all about relationships, we’ve chosen perks which illustrate that theme, and which help to bring us closer to our donors. If you pledge to support us, you won’t just be helping to remount a play; you’ll be planting the seeds for new relationships of all kinds – audiences and artists, business partners for future productions, and friendships might just last a lifetime.

But we also know that supporters like to get something tangible to remember us by. Take a look at the perk list on the right side of your screen to see what we're offering by way of thanks. Remember, no contribution is too small! 

NOTE: If you're interested in donating $100 or more, but you don't live in Toronto or Sydney, send us a message and we'll find an alternative to complimentary tickets. Maybe we can convince a theatre company near you to toss some comps your way. Or we can mail you a gift certificate for your favourite artsy outlet. Help us help you help us!

Risk Time Last Time

One of our favourite quotes comes from Tom Stoppard's screenplay for Shakespeare in Love: the theatre business "is one of insurmountable obstacles on the road to imminent disaster." Yet somehow, "it all turns out well." That has been our experience on innumerable previous productions -- even when disaster seems imminent, art conquers all!

However, if you are not a theatre practitioner, you might require some more concrete assurances before investing in our project. Here is why we are 100% confident that we can pull this off:
  • Between the three core collective members, we've had experience producing and performing in over 100 indie, community, and professional shows.
  • One of our team members (Wesley Colford) has produced numerous shows in Toronto before.
  • Another team member (Scott Sharplin) has toured shows all across Cape Breton, and once toured a show from Ottawa to Victoria without a hitch!
  • Our production of First Time Last Time is all ready to go! The set, props, costumes, and tech have already been finalized.
  • We have community connections on the ground in Toronto, and at our halfway point (in Fredericton, NB), ready to help us out with billeting, postering, and generating buzz.
  • By helping us raise publicity funds, you're doubling down on your investment, because more publicity dollars equals more tickets sold!

Help Time Last Time

Even if you don't have the funds to contribute to our campaign, you can still help us make the tour a success"

  • Spread the word! Use Indiegogo share tools to distribute buzz through social media. Or, if you have some dedicated theatre geeks in your contact list, shoot them an email about the campaign!
  • Visit our Facebook event page, and share share share!
  • Follow us on Twitter, and retweet retweet retweet (try saying that three times fast!).

No matter what you decide, THANK YOU for hearing us out, and for even being remotely interested in supporting indie Canadian theatre. You're amazing!

*Photos by Chris Walzak*

story:
We need to raise money to give Central Youth Theatre the home it deserves after 32 years of fabulous work with young people from Wolverhampton and surrounding areas. Our new home could be within the old Co-op building just across the road from The Grand Theatre, smack bang in the centre of the City.


If we raise £20,000 it will give us a stake in the redevelopment of this amazing, iconic building...it will be the cement that secures the foundations of our new home This crowdfunding campaign is central to realising our ambitious dreams.

We are aiming to create a space where young people not only enhance their creative skills in performing and associated technical skills, but also grow in confidence, meet other like-minded young people and most importantly come together to have fun. There is no greater gift than a safe, secure fun filled childhood; one which creates a life-time of precious memories. 

If you can help us do this we have some great rewards you can receive in return for pledging a little of your hard earned cash.

For those of you who may have slightly deeper pockets for a pledge of £5,000  we will create an original piece of drama around a person/story of your choice. Perhaps there is an unsung hero in your family history who you’ve always thought deserved some form of recognition? Perhaps it’s your next door neighbour who’s done something truly special…maybe it’s just you…? Over a twelve month period CYT will develop a script and then present YOUR play at a theatre in Wolverhampton where you and your friends and family will be guests of honour. The play will be professionally filmed and you will have your very own copy to keep!

This is a great cause that will ensure generations of young people will have the opportunity to be members of Wolverhampton's Central Youth Theatre.

Please support our campaign and tell your friends! 

#CYTHeart

Putting art in the heart of Wolverhampton

is no greater gift than a safe, secure fun filled childhood; one which creates
a life-time of precious memories.  If you can help us do this we have some great rewards you can receive in return for pledging a little of your hard earned cash.For
those of you who may have slightly deeper pockets for a pledge of £5,000  we will create an original piece of drama
around a person/story of your choice. Perhaps there is an unsung hero in your
family history who you’ve always thought deserved some form of
recognition? Perhaps it’s your next door neighbour who’s done something truly
special…maybe it’s just you…? Over a twelve month period CYT will develop a
script and then present YOUR play at a theatre in Wolverhampton where you and your friends and family will be guests of honour. The play will
be professionally filmed and you will have your very own copy to keep!This is a great cause that will ensure generations of young people will have the opportunity to be members of Wolverhampton's Central Youth Theatre. Please support our campaign and tell your friends! 
#CYTHeart
Putting art in the heart of Wolverhampton

story:
Who Are You?

Hi there!  We are MOD Theatre Company.  We’re a NYC based non-profit theatre company dedicated to bringing the classics to life on stage with artistic vision and prowess. We want everyone from grade-schoolers to the well-seasoned theater goer to fall in love (or back in love) with the greatest literary and theatrical works of all time. We are currently raising funds for our flagship production: MOD Theatre's adaptation of Charles Dickens ghostly classic “A Christmas Carol” which will run this season from Dec.16-Dec. 23 at the Clurman Theater on Theatre Row in NYC.  The rest of our season includes our adaptations of Nathaniel Hawthorne's "The Scarlet Letter" and Mary Shelley's "Frankenstein."

Why Do You Care?

Because the classics are amazing, that’s why!!!  Not only are they the gateways into the minds of the most enlightened men and women in history, true classics contain themes that are universally applicable, stories that are unquestionably captivating, and characters that are multi-layered and infinitely interpretable.  Perhaps more importantly, classic literature has the power to make us ask the deep questions that help us become better humans.  As such, classics are incubators for great theatre.  Charles Dickens “A Christmas Carol” is a well-beloved example of these ideals and an obvious first choice for our company.

Why Should I Care?

Because it’s going to be awesome and you don’t want to miss it!  You want to be totally deep and impress those around you with your knowledge of classic texts, right?  You want to see amazing theatrical adaptations that make you laugh, cry, and question yes?  Then you definitely want to see “A Christmas Carol” off-Broadway this season because it will literally make your Christmas! In all sincerity, our production is deeply creative, deeply moving, and definitely not to be missed.

What If I Think You Guys Sound Really Great But I Don’t Want To Give You My Money Because I Don’t Live In NYC And I’m Nice But I’m Not So Nice That I Would Give My Money To A Show That I’m Not Even Going To Get To See?

Well, if you think we’re great but you don’t want to give us your money because you don’t live in NYC and you’re nice but you’re not so nice that you would give your money to a show that you’re not even going to get to see, you’re in luck!  We’re taking our shows on the road!!  That’s right! The mission of our company is not limited to NYC.  In phase 2 for MOD Theatre, we will be taking productions, like  “A Christmas Carol” in NYC, and bring them to your hometown ASAP.  Though the majority of us have been in the City long enough to call ourselves New Yorkers, we hail from Utah, Idaho, Florida, Virginia and everywhere in between.  We want to give back to the communities that gave us so much by bringing them professional New York theatre that is culturally relevant and family affordable.  Theatre doesn’t happen in a vacuum and if we kept our excitement in New York that would suck!

Well, if MOD Is So Community Minded Then Why Don’t You Just Do Shows Out Here To Begin With?

Ok, we will!  Seriously. In phase 3 of our plan, we will bring the experience of creating a show out to communities across the country, giving students of theatre and the arts opportunities that are often available only in New York.  We plan to: build, perform, and adapt new productions with local colleges, cast local students and actors in our shows, and then bring them to NYC to be in the Off-Broadway premiere of that production. 

As artists and educators we know how difficult the transition into the “real world” can be. We want be a stepping-stone for students and young performers by giving them the tools, training, and opportunities they need to begin building a successful career. 

So What Do You Need From Me?

Glad you asked! We need to raise $22,500 through this campaign to cover capital costs for theater rental, costumes, sound, scenery, props, lighting, a small stipend for our actors.  If possible, we hope to exceed that amount to enhance our already extremely tight budget and start moving on phase 2 and 3 of our mission right away!  

In short we need your support.  Our Company is important to you, to us, and to our communities.  Help us give MOD Theatre a home in NYC this Christmas, and home in your town soon!



Are you looking for end of year tax deductions?  Contact MOD Theatre Company at modtheatrecompany@gmail.com

Check out our website at www.modtheatre.org

Photo Credit: Mark J Davis  www.mark-j-davis.com

story:
El viaje de La Extranjera

La Extranjera es un espectáculo flamenco que hace un tributo a Gabriela Mistral.  Teje historias paralelas y actuales en relación a su historia,revisa aspectos de su biografía en relación a su emigración y su desarraigo, tematica en la que me identifico y hago un paralelo con mi propia historia , proponiendo así un dialogo imaginario con las constantes reflexiones y poesía de Gabriela en relación a este tema. Este espectáculo fué estrenado el 16 de Octubre en Conde Duque en Madrid, Integra artistas Chilenos radicados en España otros que viajaron desde Chile a España y artistas Españoles. El proyecto esta siendo documentado por Macarena Echeverría, para realizar el documental de todo el proceso y creacíon de La Extranjera.
 Ahora viene nuestro segundo y gran desafío que es trasladar a los artistas invitados a Chile, para nuestro estreno y temporada en GAM, del 9 al 20 de Diciembre, donde hemos sido invitados a celebrar el premio Nobel de nuestra poetiza.
La Típica
La Compañía se creo en 2007 en Londres a raíz de mi reencuentro con Jorge Bravo, junto a quién habíamos recorrido un camino anterior en Palo Santo, La típica ha sido y es un proyecto abierto que ha tomado elementos de otras disciplinas y ha colaborado con artistas que provienen de otros lenguajes, lo que ha influenciado nuestro trabajo. Juntos hemos hecho las obras "Desde el Silencio" "Acuerdate de mi...Lola" "Cambiar de Piel" y "La Extranjera"
 La Típica ha constituido un ejemplo para que otros creadores caminen en esta misma dirección. Este viaje también potencia el flamenco de Chile, y puede generar apertura en el flamenco y puntos de encuentro con otras disciplinas , de alguna manera el viaje de La Extranjera es un viaje de ida y vuelta, que recoge esta relación con Chile y la instala donde se gestó.
Natalia Garcia-Huidobro

Naci en Santiago de Chile en una familia de gente de Teatro.  Comence a bailar  en México entre 1992 y 1997, donde forme parte de la compañía  Danza En Cruz, en los montajes "Territorio Uno" y "Santa Fiesta".

En 2000, formamos Palo Santo, en Chile,con quienes creamos, "A Ras de Tierra" y "Memorias del Viento", ambos tuvieron un impacto significativo en la escena artística chilena. El éxito de este trabajo llevó Palo Santo a presentarse en diversos festivales y giras por todo Chile y México.

En 2003 me traslade a Madrid, donde recido hasta hoy, para estudiar  en la academia de baile flamenco Amor de Dios . Desde entonces, he actuado con regularidad en los "tablaos"  de Madrid, (Corral de la Moreria, Cafe de Chinitas, Las Carboneras) , he colaborado con diversas compañías como Arte Flamenco, Glimt Theatre y he enseñado en : Italia, República Checa, Rusia, Dinamarca, Grecia, Inglaterra,Japón.

Desde 2007 he tenido un fuerte desarrollo en Inglaterra, donde aparte del trabajo de "La Tipica"con quienes hemos recorrido todo UK, he realizado colaboraciones frecuentes con los grupos musicales "Eclipse" , "Kosmos" entre otros.

Entre mis recientes colaboraciónes  esta la producción de los ensayos de I´M Mapuche del coreógrafo Lemi Ponifasio , compañía MAU . Producida por Santiago a Mil. Y la creación de la pieza "Good Vibrations" para Shrewsbury folk festival, junto a destacados artistas e India e Inglaterra.

story:
Help support a production of Albert Camus' The Just in Spring/Summer 2016. 


In December 2014 I first encountered Albert Camus' The Just.
Deeply moved, I initiated conversations with friends in the theater community, and everyone I approached was as moved and excited by the play as I.  Good sign. I resolved to see the play produced. As I began closely exploring the text I had serious problems with the existing English translations. I began work on translating the play myself, and approached actors to explore, develop and refine the new text. On October 19th these actors will present the new translation to an audience in a minimally staged script-in-hand performance at 1FiftyOne Gallery. And in 2016 I intend to produce the play for a full public run. 

So, About That Full Run: 

This campaign will make that production happen!  Your contribution to will ensure our ability to:

secure our current actors for next year
continue dramaturgical work
rent rehearsal space
cover material costs of the show in advance of the show
add additional support crew who will do their jobs better than I can.
all while guaranteeing the cast and crew what they deserve for their incredible work.

While ticket sales and local funding sources are an important component of a stage production's budget, they very rarely amount to 100% of the costs. Beginning ahead allows us two vital freedoms in addition to those listed above: The freedom to include all audiences, without needing to turn away those who can't afford a ticket; and the freedom to fail - to postpone a production which is not ready for prime time, without, as too often occurs, binding cast and crew on the altar of ticket sales, asking them  to sacrifice their reputations just to recover 50% of costs.

You'll notice a lack of "unique perks" because I believe this production is the best perk I can offer. 

Whether this campaign earns 50 dollars or 50,000, every cent will go towards extending and deepening our rehearsal and development work so that this play can be properly offered to an audience.


Can't contribute so much as a dollar? This play's very much about you then. 
Spread the word, share this campaign, and reach out to us by email to keep apprised of our process.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for visiting our Speak Now campaign!  Speak Now will debut February 27th, 2015 at The Missing Piece Theater in Burbank at 8pm every Friday and Saturday night for four weeks!  But, we need your help to see this through!

Speak Now is a story of four high school friends reunited for the marriage of their best friend, Nella.   What the girls don't realize is that Nella has been keeping a secret that could potentially ruin, not only friendships, but lives.

Speak now is an almost all-female cast and "speaks" to many of the social issues in our modern society.  From subjects such as eating disorders to the ultimate question of what it takes to hold a faithful marriage, this story is has a voice for anyone to hear and, hopefully, gain from.

So much dedication and passion has already gone into the development of this story.  We have been so blessed with everything from the theater to the amazing cast of this play and we're so excited to bring this story to life for you! 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to see this story completely come alive!

  • We need $5,000.00 to start.  This will help us pay for the theater rental and our promotional needs to get this story out into the world.  Anything we make beyond that will help us with our stretch goals.  And we have some big plans for this story!
  • We have gifts for you!  From an AWESOME "Speak Now" mug to a free ticket to the play!  Check out all the crazy gifts we're offering!
  • Anything we make will go towards our needs to support this play.  Your additional support is so important to further this story for us and we are grateful for anything we are able to raise!

Stretch Goals

Bringing this story to the stage has not come without its challenges.  We have so many plans for this story, it does not stop with The Missing Piece Theater.  If we go beyond our $5,000 goal, these are just some of the things we would like to see happen with Speak Now:

  • We would LOVE to be able to pay our amazing actors.  They have already dedicated so much of their heart and creativity with this story.  We would love to return the favor.  If we reach $6,000 we will be able to do that!
  • Making the feature film.  Plans for this are already in motion.  Any extra money we make beyond what we need for the play will help us bring this to the big screen!  We plan on taking this story to screen and submitting to major festivals such as Sundance and Toronto.
  • Additional funds will also help take this play to The Fringe festival - our big dream with this;  To take is to the Fringe in Edinburgh!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many other ways you can help support this play besides donating money and it's just as valuable!

  • Take pictures!  We live in a social media era.  Come to the play and help promote us on all social medias using our hashtag #betterspeaknow
  • Tell your friends and family about the play!  Be sure to come see us anytime during the shows run.  Opening night is sure to sell out fast, so reserve your tickets ahead of time to be there for our opening night party and celebrate everything you have helped us with!
  • Visit www.facebook.com/speaknowplay and like our page.  Then send it to your friends!
  • Buy tickets to the play and we'll see ya February 27th!

Thank you!!!

story:
CROWDFUNDING HAS ENDED - YOU CAN STILL SUPPORT THIS JOURNEY AND KEEP UP TO DATE ON THE EVENT PAGE.

https://www.facebook.com/events/496766880504708/

If you are  interested in any of the rewards please contact me via email. sacredphoenix8@gmail.com

Celebrate our vision and support our project WILD ECHOES - An empowering journey for women - featuring Zola Dubnikova * Visionary Sacred Dance artist.* In Australia 2016 * Includes a retreat in sacred dance practices * Community outreach workshops that help women heal from trauma * Sample classes in different styles of dance and extraordinary performances*

About Us

Rachael Otto 

Project Manager, Vision founder

Founder of Wild Echoes a Sacred Phoenix event.
Artist, Graphic Designer and Community arts worker. Her experience working in a multitude of community organisations for many years, developing arts projects and creating resources that raise awareness and create opportunities has set the perfect foundation for 'Sacred Phoenix' an emerging business that will host visionaries, support creative collaborations with community and focus on social action.

Through experiencing Sacred Dance via Holly Wodetski's incredible workshops and seeing Zola online I discovered how dance is a profoundly uplifting, expressive and healing journey. At a time in my life of massive change, transformations in body and spirit, dancing was exactly what I needed on my new journey through motherhood. I discovered how important it is to reconnect to your heart and free yourself of social constrictions or expectations and follow your instincts. Dance allows us this primal expression and release, connecting with our body in a profound way that is uniquely empowering and transformational. 

Zola and I have a shared vision to reach out to women in the community and from services such as domestic violence, sexual assault, homeless, & refugee and offer a sacred dance project that helps these women heal from trauma.

Zola Dubnikova


Sacred Artist

An international dance artist, traveller, performer and teacher, Zola’s love for dance led her to study with masters around the world. 

In addition to Zola’s training in mystical dance arts of the world, her study of various healing techniques and her work with women healing from sexual trauma havs given her insight into the relationship between dance and sacred tradition and healing. 

http://www.zoladubnikova.com/zola_dubnikova/About_Zola_Dubnikova.html

The Wild Echoes event includes: 

  • Community outreach to women affected by domestic violence, homelessness, refugee, and sexual assault.
  • A series of workshops offered by Zola Dubnikova and local artists in community organisation collaboration that focus on supporting Women Heal from trauma
  • A Rainforest Retreat experience a deep immersion into Holistic Dance with Zola Dubnikova
  • Inner city workshops that sample different styles of dance. Perfect for beginners or advanced dance students wishing to try Flamenco, Rajasthani, Odissi and more.
  • An extraordinary performance by Zola Dubnikova and guest artists celebrating diversity and empowerment.

Holistic Dance:

Pleasurable embodiment, diverse physicality, subtle body language, ritual movement and inner alchemy are the main elements of the holistic dance language curriculum. Informed by ancient tradition, steeped in contemporary somatic/body science, infused with movement medicine and immersed in sacred dance inspired across time and worlds, the practices revive our hidden (forgotten) abilities, creating pathways of remembrance in the body.

Find out more here:

http://www.zoladubnikova.com/zola_dubnikova/Sample_classes_Zola_Dubnikova.html

_____________________________________________________________________

YOU are bringing dancer Zola Dubnikova to Australia to teach her world renowned Sacred Dance Workshop for Women.

Zola’s diverse experience performing and teaching worldwide is informed by an education spanning across many worlds over more than two decades… Her immersions into : Sufi whirling traditions inspired by dervishes of the Mevlavi order, the dances of the Orixas during her travels in Brazil, the snake charming gypsy dances of Rajasthan during her nomadic desert lifestyle - when living with the Khalbelia tribe of India, the roots of Andalucinian flamenco when she lived and studied under masters in the legendary cuevas of Southern Spain and her initiation into the Ancient Classical Odissi Temple dance lineage when living in Orissa (India), along with her contemporary dance training, healing arts background and sacred dance aesthetic all give her a rich well from which to make her offerings.

YOU are supporting a creative culture in Australia
..in a time when the arts need your support.

YOU are supporting women find confidence and healing through creative movement and expression.

YOU are supporting the diversity of culture and the recognition and celebration of cultural arts.

YOU are supporting women creating opportunities for creative skill development, and new creative business ventures.

____________________________________________________________________

We need support to make this happen.

To collaborate and deliver such important work to the women in our community, 
We need your help with the cost of flights, Artist funding and venue hire.
$2,500   flights from Israel to Brisbane Australia for Zola Dubnikova
$2,000  artist funding
$500      venue hire
____________________________________________________________________
Unique Perks Available including:

1.

Workshops:

The Path of Feminine Embodiment - guided by Holly Wodetski


www.sacreddance.com.au

cost:$25

(limit: 30)

When: Friday 11 December 2015, 7-9pm
Where: VIDA Dance Studios, 474 Ipswich Road, Annerley

Sacred Dance uniquely approaches the energetic, devotional and spiritual practice of dance within the shapes of belly dance and Indian temple dance united with tantric yoga and awareness of the heart. We take a feminine approach of accepting the invitation of the physical body to enter the present moment. Since our physical body is always here and now and only the mind can dwell in the past and future, as we drop deeper into our bodies, expanding our awareness there, we naturally become more present, spontaneous and connected with what is. This class will provide the philosophy and experiential practice required to enter a state of gracious authentic movement that is centred around surrender into dance itself. Where the individual is no longer dancing and the dancing is simply happening…unfolding moment to moment from the heart. Sacred Dance incorporates yogic practices for relaxing the mind and becoming deeply aware of the physical body, belly dance technique for opening and energizing the chakras, and guided free dance to surrender, fall in love and embrace the magical unity of dancing with no mind.

Come join us in awakening the dance in your heart!

About:

Holly Wodetzki, dance teacher and performer of Sacred Dance is passionate about awakening the feminine nature and embodying it in an artistic expression of love, grace and beauty. She is immensely grateful to have trained extensively worldwide in belly dance, classical Indian temple dance, Mystical dance, left and right hand tantric yoga, and meditation with many beloved teachers over the last 10 years. She wholeheartedly hopes to offer back to the world and share with others, the same joy and wisdom it shares with her. She believes in the power of dance with all her heart, and prays her experience and offering of Sacred Dance will also enrich and enliven the hearts of women everywhere to reclaim and embody more kindness and love within and on this planet, for the benefit of all beings.
...........................................................................................................................................................

2.

Workshops:

Tribal Bellydance Taster with Siân Bhala


www.opalesquedance.com/

When: Thursday December 3rd. 6:30-8:30pm

Where: The Danceworks – 19 Burke St Woolloongabba

(Limit 20)

Cost $25

ATS® Tribal Bellydance is both earthy and artistic, blending the folkloric movements of the Middle East and India with the sinuous elegance of contemporary dance forms. The posture is open and uplifted, grounded with strong arms, graceful movements and body alignment.

Though it is a modern day dance the feeling is ancient and sacred; with vibrant costuming, music, movements and a strong connection between the dancers.
Using powerful and graceful combinations (that draw from Sian’s own dance repertoire and the movement vocabulary of ATS®) we will dance as a tribe with this exciting and organic dance style.

In this workshop, attention will be given to exploring concepts of movement, as well as clear breakdown of technique and understanding of body mechanics that prevent injury and improve dance form. This workshop is accessible to all levels of dance experience.

.......................................................................................................................................................

3.

Zola skype lessons

An incredible opportunity to study one on one with Zola

$200 for 1.5 hr


...........................................................................................................................................................

4.

Sacred Phoenix art (from $10-$40)

Light. Seeds. Light prints and more available

Please see gallery or message sacredphoenix8@gmail.com to request to see the full gallery of images


..................................................................................................................................................
5.
'Eternity' Book
Capturing the beauty of the extraordinary performances at 'Eternity'. Photography by Krystal Beazley of Applejack Effectz.
(Photography to be included in the book can be seen in the gallery)


About
Krystal Beazley, Sole Owner/Artist of photography and makeup service APPLEJACK EFFECTZ founded in 2007 and based in Brisbane, QLD, Australia.

In a nutshell...
Growing up, I would use art as an outlet to get out of my own head and to find a place of escape and solitude. My whole world changed when I was able to clearly see and feel the benefits of expression through art and how it could potentially empower others also. Such a profound realization!

As a result, AppleJack Effectz offer a unique experience that embraces the power of self exploration, embodiment, transformation, healing and growth through being creative.

I have come to strongly understand the importance of doing what feels good, even if you don't understand it. For me, it is taking photos and sharing a creative journey with others. Allowing others the same opportunity to explore the peace in discovering something beautiful, which often lies within them!

https://www.facebook.com/AppleJack-Effectz-185769758200177/timeline/

http://ajeffectx.wix.com/applejackeffectz


More rewards are available. To purchase please go to the Perks link.

__________________________________________________________________________

If we do not reach our entire goal we will allocate the funds to a smaller scale project or continue fundraising.

__________________________________________________________________________

The Impact of Wild Echoes

The difference this makes to the lives of women and their families is profound. Many women affected by trauma and violence can find inner strength and healing through creative discovery.

'When women thrive, community thrives'
By aiding women you are contributing to the prosperity of this generation and the next. Creative projects for women that embrace culture and the arts foster change and awareness in issues such as homelessness, domestic violence, sexual abuse and mental health. Creative projects also harbour connection, resilience, healing, confidence, discovery, trust, honesty, love and friendships.

This dance project for women will develop a profound connection to the inner self, the body and the community opening channels for growth and empowerment.

Sacred Phoenix aims to host Zola Dubnikova annually/biannually in Australia Also building on the success of this campaign I hope to continue to host many visionaries and develop opportunities for community arts.

_____________________________________________________________________

History:

Rachael Otto has a successful track record in the delivery of community arts projects, fundraising and resource development in collaboration and employment with various community organisations.

Former project development include:

  • Workshops and performance with homeless young people. A Brisbane Youth service and Rock'n'Roll circus project 
  • Development of resources dealing with Sexual violence with ZigZag Womens resource centre and a multitude of health resources for young people dealing with drug and alcohol issues.
  • Music and arts project development and workshops addressing mental health for Homeless young people with government grant funding.
  • Graphic designer in various community organisations.
  • In 2015 collaborated in the production of 'Eternity' a performance showcase and fundraiser

Zola Dubnikova 

http://www.zoladubnikova.com/zola_dubnikova/About_Zola_Dubnikova.html

In addition to Zola’s training in mystical dance arts of the world, her study of various healing techniques and her work with women healing from sexual trauma has given her insight into the relationship between dance, sacred tradition & healing.  In 1999, Zola conducted a three-month dance project at a clinic for women called SAGE (Standing Against Global Exploitation) to bring healing movement to women who are survivors of sexual exploitation, violence and prostitution.  She also trained extensively and received certifications in dance medicine (8 month advanced course - which included Feldenkrais, Alexander and other unique somatic training) pilates, (8 month intensive training) and massage (California-certified).  Additionally,  she received extensive training in other somatic (body- mind)  approaches such as  the Rosen Method, Continuum, specialized massage courses, specialized yoga courses and more.  After several journeys to Mexico/Central America, she also began to participate in powerful ceremonies based on indigenous ancient tradition, which also deeply influenced her being & work.  Through these ceremonies, she rediscovered the power of the breath, voice & sound, as one of the most powerful healing tools we all have at our fingertips.

Zola’s work as a movement therapy specialist alongside physical therapy doctors in a clinical setting (SOL PT), where she saw many patients healing from chronic pain,  also deeply informed her understanding of human anatomy, movement, psychology and the body.  Aside from this,  she also ran a private professional practice for 8 years working individually with people while continuing to teach dance courses all the while.


Risks & Challenges


Challenge of engagement with clients of services that are in crisis mode and lack of confidence and or fear to try something new.

Overcoming these challenges
  • Drawing from an extensive background and experience working with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures will help guide our workshops
  • In collaboration with services, we will have qualified support workers that can support the participants.
  • In lead up to the workshops there will be various introductory workshops.

In the delivery of all workshops..

  • We will support women to participate in many ways for instance for mothers groups from homeless services transport will be provided and babysitting.
  • Support workers can attend and participate freely as well as clients. adding to the participants security.
  • Workshop space will be chosen according to the comfort and security and 'ease of access' of each group.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out! share our posts and video through your networks..

CROWDFUNDING HAS ENDED - YOU CAN STILL SUPPORT THIS JOURNEY AND KEEP UP TO DATE ON THE EVENT PAGE.
https://www.facebook.com/events/496766880504708/
If you are  interested in any of the rewards please contact me via email. sacredphoenix8@gmail.com
Celebrate our vision and support our project WILD ECHOES - An empowering journey for women - featuring Zola Dubnikova * Visionary Sacred Dance artist.* In Australia 2016 * Includes a retreat in sacred dance practices * Community outreach workshops that help women heal from trauma * Sample classes in different styles of dance and extraordinary performances*



About Us
Rachael Otto 
Project Manager, Vision founder
Founder of Wild Echoes a Sacred Phoenix event.Artist, Graphic Designer and Community arts worker. Her experience working in a multitude of community organisations for many years, developing arts projects and creating resources that raise awareness and create opportunities has set the perfect foundation for 'Sacred Phoenix' an emerging business that will host visionaries, support creative collaborations with community and focus on social action.
Through experiencing Sacred Dance via Holly Wodetski's incredible workshops and seeing Zola online I discovered how dance is a profoundly uplifting, expressive and healing journey. At a time in my life of massive change, transformations in body and spirit, dancing was exactly what I needed on my new journey through motherhood. I discovered how important it is to reconnect to your heart and free yourself of social constrictions or expectations and follow your instincts. Dance allows us this primal expression and release, connecting with our body in a profound way that is uniquely empowering and transformational. 
Zola and I have a shared vision to reach out to women in the community and from services such as domestic violence, sexual assault, homeless, & refugee and offer a sacred dance project that helps these women heal from trauma.
Zola Dubnikova



Sacred Artist
An international dance artist, traveller, performer and teacher, Zola’s love for dance led her to study with masters around the world. 
In addition to Zola’s training in mystical dance arts of the world, her study of various healing techniques and her work with women healing from sexual trauma havs given her insight into the relationship between dance and sacred tradition and healing. 
http://www.zoladubnikova.com/zola_dubnikova/About_Zola_Dubnikova.html

The Wild Echoes event includes: 



Community outreach to women affected by domestic violence, homelessness, refugee, and sexual assault.


A series of workshops offered by Zola Dubnikova and local artists in community organisation collaboration that focus on supporting Women Heal from trauma


A Rainforest Retreat experience a deep immersion into Holistic Dance with Zola Dubnikova


Inner city workshops that sample different styles of dance. Perfect for beginners or advanced dance students wishing to try Flamenco, Rajasthani, Odissi and more.


An extraordinary performance by Zola Dubnikova and guest artists celebrating diversity and empowerment.


Holistic Dance:
Pleasurable embodiment, diverse physicality, subtle body language, ritual movement and inner alchemy are the main elements of the holistic dance language curriculum. Informed by ancient tradition, steeped in contemporary somatic/body science, infused with movement medicine and immersed in sacred dance inspired across time and worlds, the practices revive our hidden (forgotten) abilities, creating pathways of remembrance in the body.
Find out more here:
http://www.zoladubnikova.com/zola_dubnikova/Sample_classes_Zola_Dubnikova.html

story:
• AAI stands for Aakansha Arts Initiative, a nonprofit entity that envisions equality in imparting education in dance, movement and performing arts. It aims to provide scholarships to potential kids and enable them to pursue various professional dance courses. Formed in the year 2012, AAI has been working with associative partners to help underprivileged dance enthusiasts get access to proper dance training, nurturing environment, building confidence and individual’s personality to dream big and being acknowledged equally as any other professional artist. Aakanksha Arts Initiative aims to provide scholarships to potential kids and enable them to pursue various professional dance courses.
  • AAI been associated with NAVJOTI INDIA FOUNDATION (Navjyoti India Foundation is a not-for-profit society, registered on January 5, 1988 by then 16 serving police officers of Delhi Police and conceived by Dr Kiran Bedi, first women IPS, and her team of North district police, with the main objective of crime prevention through welfare policing, education of street children, vocational skills for women drug peddlers and detox programs were its initiating projects.) 

  • A complete 3 months (12 weeks) course of PDSP demands 25-30k INR. and to fund 20 kids we would need approximately 6 lakhs i.e. 8500$
  • Tuition Fee - Approx 124$ (8000/- INR) per student.
  • Showcase Fee – 100$ (6500/- INR) per student.
  • Costumes – Approx 117$ (7500\- INR) per student.
  • Food and Conveyance – Approx 77$ (5000/- INR) per student.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Any amount of funds that we gather will ultimately go in the education of these  underprivileged kids like mentioned, even if we don't achieve our target. but it will result in lesser number of students benefitting from this noble endeavour. 

Our volunteers took dance and movement workshops at all the centres of NAVJYOTI foundation and choreographed dance pieces and gave exposure to these talented kids by staging their work at BIG DANCE CENTRE annual showcase for 2 years. (Big Dance is one of the premier dance schools in the country known for its state of the art facilities and it's faculty of teachers that is renowned and experienced. Big Dance family gives the right push they need to take in the right direction.)

With all the right guidance, education and motivation, 3 of the promising kids were selected in the performing cast at india’s first bollywood musical ZANGOORA, at Kingdom Of Dreams (KOD),  which was a big achievement for our AAi team that strengthened our belief in our vision.

A vision to build a state-of-the-art community equal for all children, where they realize their full potential in a society which respects artist’s work and dignity.

To accomplish what we have envisioned at AAi, we wish to make every form of dance and performing arts available to these dance enthusiasts in New Delhi by providing access to learn from the best in the dance fraternity and exposure to international techniques and its application. 

This year we are aiming to provide them intensive professional training with international teachers visiting india over the summer for BIG DANCE CENTRE’s Professional Dance Study Program, which is a 3 month summer program for amateur dancers to attain in-depth knowledge of dance and performing arts as a whole. 

Since the expenses of these facilities we wish to provide are really high, we would need optimum amount of funding. We need support of our contributors to help generously and remove this barrier of socio-economic inequality and help these kids achieve their dreams and believe in themselves as artists.

story:
Vancouver's Opera Mariposa is expanding! For our 2015-16 season, we’re excited to be launching the Mariposa Theatre Wing (MTW). With your help, we’ll be able to broaden our offerings to include plays and musicals in addition to opera – and to create more opportunities for up-and-coming performers along the way!

What is Opera Mariposa?

Opera Mariposa is a critically acclaimed Vancouver company run by young artists, for young artists. Founded in 2012 by multi-award-winning sopranos Jacqueline Ko and Robin Eder-Warren, Mariposa has quickly made a name for itself as one of the most dynamic companies on the local arts scene. Critics have hailed our performances as “a stroke of genius” (The Voice), “an evening of delight” and “a masterpiece” (Review Vancouver), with The Vancouver Project declaring, "Opera Mariposa stands at the forefront of Vancouver's opera scene." In the last three years our benefit shows have raised over $30,000 for charity, while our dedication to making opera accessible has led us to perform at street festivals, seniors’ residences, the Vancouver Public Library and more. No matter what, our mission is to create a stage for emerging talent, showcasing the most promising performers from the Lower Mainland and beyond in high-calibre shows that appeal to aficionados and new audiences alike.  

What is the Mariposa Theatre Wing?

The Mariposa Theatre Wing is a new branch of Opera Mariposa that will present plays and musicals with operatic themes, styles or influences. Running in parallel with Opera Mariposa, MTW will allow us to explore great new shows and reach new audiences, while creating even more opportunities for the talented singers of the Pacific Northwest. MTW will officially launch in February 2016 with Terrence McNally’s Master Class – a Tony Award-winning play where audiences and singers alike spend an evening with the legendary opera diva Maria Callas!

Why do we need a fundraising campaign?

We're thrilled to be conquering new territory with the Mariposa Theatre Wing – but to make MTW a success, we need your help. Compared to opera productions, plays and musicals have a lot of additional expenses. For example, most plays and musicals are still under copyright, so companies need to pay for performance rights and score rentals. Show runs are usually longer, which means higher costs for everything from venue rental to event insurance to program printing, and productions often have other associated needs (like sound equipment) that also demand budget increases. 

What your money goes toward:

Your donation will go directly towards the budget for the Mariposa Theatre Wing’s debut production, Master Class. Our campaign goal of $5,000.00 will help us cover: 

  • Performance rights
  • Scripts
  • Venue rental and insurance
  • Select technical equipment (like lighting)

We also have a stretch goal of $10,000. This goal will help us fund other production essentials, such as:

  • Costumes and props
  • Printing (posters, flyers, programs, tickets)
  • Press and production photography (essential for reporters and reviewers)
  • Artist honorariums!

If we break the $10k mark, additional funds will go directly towards the Mariposa Theatre Wing's next show. Whether you can give $1 or $1,000, every single donation plays an invaluable part in bringing our productions to life!

Other ways you can help:

If you can’t donate to our Indiegogo campaign – or if you simply want to do everything you can – there are plenty of other ways to pitch in! 

  1. Tell Your Friends: Use the share tools at the top left of this page to let people know about our campaign via Facebook, Twitter, and email. The more people spread the word, the higher our Indiegogo "GoGo Factor" increases, which leads to higher rankings, more exposure… and more donations! A hundred dollars is great, but a hundred shares can be just as powerful.
  2. Volunteer with Mariposa: Volunteers are the true stars of any theatrical production. Whether creating costumes and props, greeting audience members, helping out in the office or lending a hand backstage, we’re always looking for more helping hands. Plus, volunteers get complimentary admission to a Mariposa performance! Learn what sorts of jobs are available and how to join the team at operamariposa.com/support.
  3. Buy Tickets: Grab your tickets to Master Class – or even better, pick up a 2015-16 season pass to enjoy two Mariposa productions for one low price! Ticket prices start at just $15, so visit operamariposa.com/tickets to get ‘em before they’re gone.
  4. Rent Costumes: It’s true – Mariposa’s award-winning costume designs are available for rent! We also rent props for film and theatrical productions, and the proceeds go directly towards our own upcoming shows. Learn more at operamariposa.com/costumes.
  5. Reserve Ad Space: You can get an ad in the Mariposa show program starting at $20, or a full-colour slide in our overhead projections for only $10! All advertising proceeds help to cover our production costs – so just think of it like a donation that also helps you build your business. Learn more at operamariposa.com/support.

Questions or comments? Get in touch today!

You can connect with us through social media or via our official website below, or join our mailing list to hear about upcoming shows and/or auditions! If you want to contribute to our fundraising campaign the old-fashioned way*, you can send cheques (made out to our artistic director Jacqueline Ko) to our mailing address:

1538 West 57th Ave.
Vancouver, BC
V6P 1T2

Thank you so much for supporting Opera Mariposa's expansion. We’ll look forward to seeing you in the theatre!

* Please note that only Indiegogo campaign contributions are eligible for Indiegogo perks
story_txt:
Vancouver's Opera Mariposa is expanding! For our 2015-16 season, we’re excited to be launching the Mariposa Theatre Wing (MTW). With your help, we’ll be able to broaden our offerings to include plays and musicals in addition to opera – and to create more opportunities for up-and-coming performers along the way! What is Opera Mariposa? Opera Mariposa is a critically acclaimed Vancouver company run by young artists, for young artists. Founded in 2012 by multi-award-winning sopranos Jacqueline Ko and Robin Eder-Warren, Mariposa has quickly made a name for itself as one of the most dynamic companies on the local arts scene. Critics have hailed our performances as “a stroke of genius” (The Voice), “an evening of delight” and “a masterpiece” (Review Vancouver), with The Vancouver Project declaring, "Opera Mariposa stands at the forefront of Vancouver's opera scene." In the last three years our benefit shows have raised over $30,000 for charity, while our dedication to making opera accessible has led us to perform at street festivals, seniors’ residences, the Vancouver Public Library and more. No matter what, our mission is to create a stage for emerging talent, showcasing the most promising performers from the Lower Mainland and beyond in high-calibre shows that appeal to aficionados and new audiences alike.  

 What is the Mariposa Theatre Wing? The Mariposa Theatre Wing is a new branch of Opera Mariposa that will present plays and musicals with operatic themes, styles or influences. Running in parallel with Opera Mariposa, MTW will allow us to explore great new shows and reach new audiences, while creating even more opportunities for the talented singers of the Pacific Northwest. MTW will officially launch in February 2016 with Terrence McNally’s Master Class – a Tony Award-winning play where audiences and singers alike spend an evening with the legendary opera diva Maria Callas!  
 Why do we need a fundraising campaign?  We're thrilled to be conquering new territory with the Mariposa Theatre Wing – but to make MTW a success, we need your help. Compared to opera productions, plays and musicals have a lot of additional expenses. For example, most plays and musicals are still under copyright, so companies need to pay for performance rights and score rentals. Show runs are usually longer, which means higher costs for everything from venue rental to event insurance to program printing, and productions often have other associated needs (like sound equipment) that also demand budget increases.

Artist honorariums!

The more people spread the word, the higher our Indiegogo "GoGo Factor" increases, which leads to higher rankings, more exposure… and more donations! A hundred dollars is great, but a hundred shares can be just as powerful.


Volunteer with Mariposa: Volunteers are the true stars of any theatrical production. Whether creating costumes and props, greeting audience members, helping out in the office or lending a hand backstage, we’re always looking for more helping hands. Plus, volunteers get complimentary admission to a Mariposa performance! Learn what sorts of jobs are available and how to join the team at operamariposa.com/support.


Buy Tickets: Grab your tickets to Master Class – or even better, pick up a 2015-16 season pass to enjoy two Mariposa productions for one low price! Ticket prices start at just $15, so visit operamariposa.com/tickets to get ‘em before they’re gone.


Rent Costumes: It’s true – Mariposa’s award-winning costume designs are available for rent! We also rent props for film and theatrical productions, and the proceeds go directly towards our own upcoming shows. Learn more at operamariposa.com/costumes.


Reserve Ad Space: You can get an ad in the Mariposa show program starting at $20, or a full-colour slide in our overhead projections for only $10! All advertising proceeds help to cover our production costs – so just think of it like a donation that also helps you build your business. Learn more at operamariposa.com/support.



Questions or comments? Get in touch today!
You can connect with us through social media or via our official website below, or join our mailing list to hear about upcoming shows and/or auditions!
