story:
Dear Sobriety,

I am writing this letter to inform you of the mishaps caused by Blacklist Babes and Black Garter Dolls while you were away. Maybe you've heard they have decided to produce a Fringe 2016 show…4 shows actually. Can you believe it?!

Let me tell you they sure have been scandalous this year while you've been gone.  They wanted their own Burlesque Cabaret so they’ve danced on bars in Orlando; they took off their clothes from Pompano Beach to St. Augustine; they’ve performed on large event stages, for small private parties and even at charitable concerts all over Central Florida. Oh my, what would their mothers say?!

If that isn’t enough, those Blacklist Babes won themselves an award as a burlesque cabaret troupe in The Venue’s Amateur Burlesque contest. Did you hear what they did next?? Those boys and girls went out and performed at the main stage at Lake Eola during the Orlando Pride event. Bless their hearts.

When you are around, these hard working artists spend their days in retail, education, theme parks and college…and that ain’t cheap. Now they tell me they have dreams of this International Orlando Fringe Festival and had their show accepted for The Black Venue. Let me explain a few things involved in making the magic happen:
• Festival Fees
• Technical Production Fees
• Posters and Marketing Material
• Published Music Fees

Shake my head, those darn kids desperately need help. They rehearse twice a week and are busy performing one to five times a month. They keep telling me long nights, show day jitters, sore feet and corset mishaps are worth it to be able to produce their own show. Maybe they can get your help getting there?

I am asking for them since they've decided to name their first show extravaganza after me, ain't that sweet!  I don't want to brag, but they tell me they know it will be a good time when I show up - Mercy, these Babes and Dolls sure know how to make me blush!

Sincerely,
Black Out!

P.S. All funds raised go directly to the production of Black Out! coming to the Orlando Fringe Festival this May.  Check out the perks that are yours to keep!
story_txt:
Dear Sobriety, 
I am writing this letter to inform you of the mishaps caused by Blacklist Babes and Black Garter Dolls while you were away.  Maybe you've heard they have decided to produce a Fringe 2016 show…4 shows actually.  Can you believe it?!
Let me tell you they sure have been scandalous this year while you've been gone.  They wanted their own Burlesque Cabaret so they’ve danced on bars in Orlando; they took off their clothes from Pompano Beach to St. Augustine; they’ve performed on large event stages, for small private parties and even at charitable concerts all over Central Florida. Oh my, what would their mothers say?!
If that isn’t enough, those Blacklist Babes won themselves an award as a burlesque cabaret troupe in The Venue’s Amateur Burlesque contest.  Did you hear what they did next??  Those boys and girls went out and performed at the main stage at Lake Eola during the Orlando Pride event.  Bless their hearts.
When you are around, these hard working artists spend their days in retail, education, theme parks and college…and that ain’t cheap.  Now they tell me they have dreams of this International Orlando Fringe Festival and had their show accepted for The Black Venue.  Let me explain a few things involved in making the magic happen:
•	Festival Fees
•	Technical Production Fees
•	Posters and Marketing Material
•	Published Music Fees

Shake my head, those darn kids desperately need help.  They rehearse twice a week and are busy performing one to five times a month.  They keep telling me long nights, show day jitters, sore feet and corset mishaps are worth it to be able to produce their own show. Maybe they can get your help getting there?I am asking for them since they've decided to name their first show extravaganza after me, ain't that sweet!  I don't want to brag, but they tell me they know it will be a good time when I show up - Mercy, these Babes and Dolls sure know how to make me blush!Sincerely,
Black Out!P.S. All funds raised go directly to the production of Black Out! coming to the Orlando Fringe Festival this May.  Check out the perks that are yours to keep!

story:
About FENGARI Ensemble

FENGARI Ensemble is a theater and performing arts company that strives to produce unconventional work which focuses on combining elements of all the performing arts as well as visual art. The work is therefore quite diverse in styles and themes and is created in a collaborative way. FENGARI Ensemble provides a platform for emerging as well as seasoned professionals of different fields (focused on but not limited to the arts) and diverse cultural backgrounds, especially women and minority groups. FENGARI Ensemble tells stories that deal with social issues and raise awareness by utilizing the performing arts as a way to encourage change. FENGARI Ensemble also offers workshops and individual coaching for anyone who is passionate and curious, experienced or new to acting. For more information visit: www.fengariensemble.com


Summary of COCKPIT (by Steve Bellwood)

FENGARI Ensemble is pleased to announce it’s inaugural full-length production, and the New York premiere of Steve Bellwood’s COCKPIT.
When Tom, a poet and high school English teacher, and Diane, a feminist social sciences professor have their car break down in the suburbs of the Pacific Northwest they are aided and welcomed in for the night by Ivan, an elite mercenary in the war on terror and by his teenage wife Ruth, a former stripper turned housewife. Fueled by a liberating sense of dislocation, whiskey, curiosity and lust, both couples strive to come to a new understanding of themselves under the influence of deeply different strangers. As tensions and attractions build, the night moves towards epiphany, transgression and violence.

A darkly comical, exhilarating and intoxicating comic tragedy is swiftly entertaining while provoking some of the most relevant, current questions that US Americans can ask themselves in 2016.


Who we are - the core team and the playwright

JAMES LEAF (Co-Director/Actor (Ivan)/Producer/Co-Founder and Co-Artistic Director of FENGARI Ensemble)



James is a professional actor and director.He grew up in Ann Arbor Michigan where he had the opportunity to study Commedia dell’arte under Malcolm Tulip. James worked as an editor for Critical Moment, a libertarian socialist periodical.He attended Harvard University where he designed a special concentration in theatre allowing him to train under the directors and actors who comprised Robert Woodruff’s American Repertory Theatre. He acted in numerous productions in college where he also directed Cloud 9, Lysistrata, Marat/Sade, and Danton’s Death. After graduating James worked in New Haven Connecticut as an instructor for the National Endowment for the Arts’ Poetry Out Loud program, teaching poetry in performance to public high school students across Connecticut. James also founded The Young Mechanics Theatre Ensemble, a group dedicated to bringing politically relevant theatre to a stratified small city. He directed new work by local, New Haven playwrights, including the world-premiere of COCKPIT (formerly known as The Specials), written by Steve Bellwood, and worked as an actor at New Haven’s Long Wharf Theatre. James acted Off-Broadway at the Davenport Theatre in Othello and has worked for four years as a guest lecturer in literature and theatre at Barnard College. He has taught students ranging from 4 years old to 70, from the Great Lakes to Thailand.


LUISA MUHR (Co-Director/Actress (Diane)/Producer/Co-Founder and Co-Artistic Director of FENGARI Ensemble)



Luisa is a professional actor, singer, and director. She was born and grew up in and around Vienna, Austria. Her background reaches from movement, experimental, and puppet theater, to Yiddish and musical theater where she has performed in ensembles and as a solo artist (as an actor, singer, and/or dancer) in numerous roles and plays. Most recent credits include: Dolores at the Playroom Theater (dir. by Kathleen McNenny), several productions with the Bread and Puppet Theater (under Peter Schumann), Swan Song (Box Collective), Empire Travel Agency (Woodshed Collective), The Jazz Singer (Dora Wasserman Yiddish Theater), and Richard III. Luisa holds a B.F.A. in Theater Performance with Great Distinction from Concordia University (Montreal, Canada) and graduated from a two-year Private Professional Master Class Acting Training Program in NYC. In June 2015 she founded FENGARI Ensemble together with actor and director James Leaf. Luisa has taught as a Performing Arts Teacher (in acting, singing, and dancing) for Stagecoach Theatre Art Schools and has been a private acting and vocal instructor for several years. She is currently teaching the Theater Enrichment Program at the Bedford-Stuyvesant Collegiate in Brooklyn, New York and just got selected as one of the new work/study faculty members at the renowned Mark Morris Dance Group. For more information visit: www.LuisaMuhr.com

MIKE HANDELMAN (Tom)

Mike's previous New York theater credits include Bed Bugs and Beyond (13th Street Repertory Theater), King John (Fools and Kings Project), The Currency (Midcity Productions) and the ongoing site specific mystery show Professor Hemlock's Mansion. Some of his favorite productions in Boston include Much Ado About Nothing, A Midsummer Night's Dream, She Kills Monsters and site specific productions of Uncle Vanya, Rosencratz and Guildenstern Are Dead and Caucasian Chalk Circle. On film, he's appeared in The Forger with John Travolta and Christopher Plummer (available to stream on iTunes and Amazon Prime) and Crooked Arrows (available on Netflix Instant). He is a proud member of SAG-AFTRA.


COURTNEY TORRES (Ruth)

Courtney began taking classes at The Barrow Group and Theatre for The New City in 2013. She has consistently been involved in work ranging from stage managing to light board operating to performing on stage, where she feels most at home.  Some of her credits include Black Me Out (dir.) Seanie Sugrue, Finding My Way Home (dir.) Michael Vasquez, Truce: The Futuristic Musical for Peace (dir.) Elizabeth Ruff,  Thelonious (dir.) Peter Welch, Sacred Sow (dir.) Eleanor Cummins, Looking for Cans, (dir.) Joe Davidson, Savage (dir.), and Mary Tierney. Courtney performed various scenes between the LES Festival of the Arts, TNC's Halloween Extravaganza and Artists Without Walls at The Cell Theatre. She made her first short film appearance in Coffee, produced by Through the Lens Entertainment. Art is the guiding force of her life.

LAURA MALSEED (Stage Manager)

Laura is a professional stage and production manager who has worked for many different theater companies, including Off-Broadway. Credits include: Off-Broadway’s How 2 B A New Yorker, Unmentionables (Theatre 54), The Mutilated (New Ohio – Drama League Nomination), Pryor Truth (The Collective NY), Blank Canvas (HERE Arts Center), The Exonerated (Secret Theater), A Dance for Rylie (dir. Bob Cline). Production Manager for Nylon Fusion Theatre Company. Laura is a graduate of Pace University and a member of AEA. For more information visit: www.LauraMalseed.com

WILLIAM HAND (Producer)

William is a producer, director, and actor. Acting professionally in the Bay Area under the direction of luminaries such as Mark Jackson and Jon Tracy he has had the privilege to work on demanding and innovative productions. The thrust of his work and majority of his time was spent in the creation of Do It Live. In Do It Live, William realized his goal of giving San Francisco's emerging artists a platform to mount full productions with professional resources. By the end of his four years as Founding Artistic Director, he had a core ensemble of six actors who were paid a living wage for their work in the final season.

William led a small but effective team of production associates who facilitated their administrative needs. While he no longer continue to operate the company, William is proud to say that several of his core artists have gone on to form companies of their own in San Francisco and Chicago. In all four seasons William managed to produced nine mainstage productions.

STEVE BELLWOOD (Playwright)

Steve was born and raised in Yorkshire, England. He is a playwright, monologist, story-teller and poet, Steve has produced and performed his work in London, New York City, and for the past twenty-odd years in his adopted home-state of Connecticut, where he continues to write and perform regularly.


What you can expect...An adventurous evening of awareness!

Cockpit is a fast-paced, unpredictable comic-tragedy. You can expect an evening of laughter, surprise and excitement that at the same time takes a focused, terrifying look at contemporary American life. Romance and violence forge new identities, betrayal comes from those closest to us and the ravages of the war on terror are made visible on the suburban home front.  A play of national themes, COCKPIT examines the impossibility of finding safety through security in America.  It makes visible the phenomena of war trauma and privatized war.  It contrasts the pain of the sex industry with the grueling monotony of conventional domesticity.  It holds up to the light our national obsession with guns and speed, and asks whether our political and academic discourses are adequate to address our country’s most deeply rooted problems.  You will experience a play that inspires honest discussion and debate, that helps to clarify what is most lacking in American life, and ventures to ask how what divides Americans most from each other can be overcome by a greater degree of understanding and compassion.


Producing COCKPIT - how it all came together...

COCKPIT developed out of playwright Steve Bellwood’s experience driving cross-country with a former girlfriend and finding himself often welcomed in to strangers homes for the night.  One particular evening he met two individuals thatprovided the genesis of Ivan and Ruth.  In September 2013 his play was produced as The Specials at the Whitney Arts Center in New Haven, Connecticut to packed, energized and engaged houses.  Each evening included a long talkback with food, wine and beer, where audiences discussed and debated the political issues treated by the play, and the strengths of the script and staging.  The play was lauded in the local press. Director, James Leaf believing greatly in the strength of the script and hoping that it would be seen in New York, asked his friend and artistic partner Luisa Muhr to collaborate in giving the play a new incarnation.  Out of the desire to give the work a new treatment for a new audience FENGARI Ensemble was founded.  We are happy to be staging this production at The Balcony Theatre at The West Park Presbyterian Church, a beautiful, unconventional and dynamic venue on the Upper West Side.


Why this story - why support us?

COCKPIT emerges as a deeply urgent and timely drama that lays bare the cost of the war on terror in relation to the American domestic front.  The play explores the gap and the bridging of the gap between soldiers and civilians, men and women, those who work with their bodies and those who work with their intellects. It examines the nature of addiction and desire, the fragility of identity, the complicity in violence Americans share, and the ability of lives to change rapidly over the course of one night. 
Cockpit is if anything an urgent story.   The play is about the divisions that 

exist today between Americans and the possibility of overcoming these divisions. The work emerges as a deeply timely drama that lays bare the cost of the war on terror in relation to the American domestic front.  The play explores the gap and the bridging of the gap between soldiers and civilians, men and women, those who work with their bodies and those who work with their intellects.  It examines the nature of addiction and desire, the fragility of identity, the complicity in violence Americans share, and the ability of lives to change rapidly over the course of one night. A darklycomic, exhilarating and intoxicating comic tragedy is swiftly entertaining while provoking some of the most important questions that New Yorkers and Americans can ask themselves in 2016.

Our adventures, efforts, and highs so far


Budget – How is the money distributed and where does it go?

Most of the money goes into the theater rental – which is incredibly expensive in NYC.
Other big costs are definitely set and props, actually compensating our production and creative team, renting the lights, insurance, and marketing (mostly printing costs and advertising).

Flex Goals

It is really important that even when we have reached our goal of $5800 we please need you to keep supporting us! This first goal does NOT cover all our costs. We picked a lower goal, so that we can be assured to at least cover some of the costs. Looking ahead and calculating in what we have already had to spend, our expenses come to around  (breakdown in percentages see budget diagram). This is mostly due to the expensive rehearsal space rental in NYC (although we always rehearse at the cheapest rental studio in town), but also to cover the rent of the theater and all other expenses. We are hoping to fill the theater on all 4 performances, so are expecting to cover more costs with the ticket sales, however that is not guaranteed.

So we really need your help to raise our next goals in order to make this production work!

$6500

This will help us to cover a big amount of our costs! Thank you!

$7000

Great! We are not too far away from covering all our main costs without having to depend on ticket sales – thank you so much!

$8000

Yay! We can pretty much cover our main costs! Thank you! You are also making it possible for the amazing production and creative team to receive a fair compensation for their incredibly hard work! This is very important to us since so much work has gone into developing Dolores.

$8500 and beyond

Hooray! Apart from guaranteeing the amazing production and creative team a fair stipend you are making it possible to actually compensate the cast and director for all their hard work and immense efforts! In addition to that we will donate any amount past our $6500 flex goal to .With this we want to support an organization that focuses on supporting survivors of abuse. You have helped to really make a difference and we are so very grateful! Thank you so, so much!


Risks and Challenges

One of the exciting, challenging risks in our work on this production is choosing to commit to a new play without a significant production history based on our deep belief in the strength of the story, the writing and the utter necessity of making sure this story is told.  We are also committing to work in a very new performance venue with it’s own special challenges because we believe it is a unique and compelling space where theatre should continue to be made.  We are pursuing this fundraising-campaign largely to defray the costs of renting this wonderful theatre.  Further costs include the acquisition of a number of large and small props essential to the plot of the play, and the expenses for our lighting plan that will not be covered by the theatre.  We are also spending money in marketing this show, ensuring that we are able to fill our houses, and that this original work may be seen by as many people as possible.  Further, although many talented artists are working on this project as volunteers we are paying those who have put in serious work as actors, designers, producers and stage-managers. 


How it works - Perks

Pick a perk and go! It's all straight forward and easy, just follow the steps and you'll be done in a minute or less. And please share our campaign with your friends and family and anyone who could be interested!

Don't want to pick a perk but still want to support us? – Great! Just click on "Select Perk" and then on "No perk. I just want to contribute". Thank you so much! We really appreciate it!


To all Donors

Thank you so much for supporting us in this! This is for a good cause and we promise to do our very best to make this production the most professional and everything it deserves to be! We are doing our very best to shine light on a topic that is not getting a lot of attention and we could not do this without your help. From the bottom of our hearts: Thank you!

FAQs

  • Can I donate even if I live abroad (not in the US):  Yes, you can. We accept international donations and encourage everyone to help supporting this project.
  • Will my name be publicly displayed once I have made a donation: No, not if you don’t want it to. Simply select "Hide my name" when you make your donation.
  • Can I get involved with FENGARI Ensemble? Yes. We are always looking for eager people to get involved. Please contact us under fengariensemble@gmail.com and we will get back to as soon as possible on how you can get involved. Artists of all backgrounds (theater, music, dance, visual art,...) are welcome!

How else you can help…

  • Come to our show! :) (Tickets: Direct Link to TICKETS and via our website: www.fengariensemble.com)
  • Like us on Facebook and Twitter! (FENGARI Ensemble Page, FENGARI Ensemble on Twitter)
  • Join our COCKPIT Facebook Event! (COCKPIT Facebook Event Page)
  • Spread the word! Tell your friends and family about our campaign, the production itself, and share a link on facebook and twitter!

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions: fengariensemble@gmail.com

THANK YOU!

Luisa and James
(in the name of the entire team)

supporting survivors of abuse. You have helped to really make a 
difference and we are so very grateful! Thank you so, so much! 

Risks and Challenges

One of the exciting, challenging risks in our work on this production is choosing to commit to a new play without a significant production history based on our deep belief in the strength of the story, the writing and the utter necessity of making sure this story is told.  We are also committing to work in a very new performance venue with it’s own special challenges because we believe it is a unique and compelling space where theatre should continue to be made.  We are pursuing this fundraising-campaign largely to defray the costs of renting this wonderful theatre.  Further costs include the acquisition of a number of large and small props essential to the plot of the play, and the expenses for our lighting plan that will not be covered by the theatre.  We are also spending money in marketing this show, ensuring that we are able to fill our houses, and that this original work may be seen by as many people as possible.  Further, although many talented artists are working on this project as volunteers we are paying those who have put in serious work as actors, designers, producers and stage-managers. 

How it works - Perks
Pick a perk 
and go! It's all straight forward and easy, just follow the steps and 
you'll be done in a minute or less. And please share our campaign with your friends and family and 
anyone who could be interested!
Don't want to pick a perk but 
still want to support us? – Great! Just click on "Select Perk" and then 
on "No perk. I just want to contribute". Thank you so much! We really 
appreciate it!

To all Donors
Thank you so much for 
supporting us in this! This is for a good cause and we promise to do our
 very best to make
this production the most professional and everything it deserves to be! 
We are doing our very best to shine light on a topic that is not getting
 a lot of attention and we
could not do this without your help. From the bottom of our hearts: 
Thank you!

FAQs


Can I donate even if I live abroad (not in the US):  Yes, you can. We accept
international donations and encourage everyone to help supporting this project.

Will my name be publicly displayed once I have made a donation: No, not if you don’t want it to. Simply select "Hide my name" when you make your donation. 

Can I get involved with FENGARI Ensemble? Yes. We are 
always looking for eager people to get involved. Please contact us under
fengariensemble@gmail.com and we will
get back to as soon as possible on how you can get involved. Artists of 
all backgrounds (theater, music, dance, visual art,...) are welcome!

How else you can help… 

Come to our show! :) (Tickets: Direct Link to TICKETS and via our website: www.fengariensemble.com)

Like us on Facebook and Twitter! (FENGARI Ensemble Page, FENGARI Ensemble on Twitter)
Join our COCKPIT Facebook Event! (COCKPIT Facebook Event Page)

Spread the word! Tell your friends and family
     about our campaign, the production itself, and share a link on facebook and twitter!

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions:
fengariensemble@gmail.com
THANK YOU!
Luisa and James(in the name of the entire team)

story:
Help Wales' storytelling festival create a new, ground-breaking work which will explore gender and identity through the combination of stories, images and music. 

Who is Beyond the Border?

Beyond the Border Storytelling Festival is the UK's leading storytelling festival dedicated to the telling of traditional world myths and legends. Based in the Vale of Glamorgan in South Wales, we bring world-renowned storytellers to a beautiful fairy tale castle by the sea every other year, to give a weekend of performances encompassing storytelling, theatre, music, dance, circus and puppetry, to around 3000 festival-goers from Wales and the world. 

We explore universal truths about humanity and the world through the magic of stories. 

What are we raising money for?

Our 2016 festival takes place from 1-3 July.  This year we are delving into the fluidity of identity and gender, looking at them through the prism of legends and traditional stories. 

We are commissioning the great Swedish storyteller, Mats Rehnman, to create a new work and we would like your help to make it happen.

The piece, entitled Metamorph - Legends Beyond Norms will be a daring mixed art-form piece – words, music and live graphics. Mats will take stories from Greek, Arabic and Indian traditions, and combine them with digital imagery and live music performed by violinist Emma Reid (Methera String Quartet). 

We would like to raise £1000 towards the costs (artists fees, travel and accommodation) of creating this new work, which will be premiered at the festival in July and will look forward to future performances worldwide thereafter. 

Metamorph will

- bring gender issues to mainstream audiences in an exciting and unforgettable way

- push the boundaries of the artform of performance storytelling and develop it through cross-fertilisation with other art forms.

-  take people to the edge of their comfort zone, and help adults re-discover the wonder of losing themselves in a story 

All donations, however small, will go directly towards the costs of making the commission.  If the campaign is successful, we will be able to make video footage from the premiere performance available on our website after the festival. If we If we get more than £1000 we'll be chuffed to bits, and will look to expand the theme of gender and identity in future partnerships. 

If you don't want to participate in this crowd funding campaign look at other options to get involved: http://www.beyondtheborder.com/supportus/

If you can't contribute financially, please tell your contacts about the campaign, and please use the Indiegogo share tools as much as you can.

story:
A Ruff Guide to: The Ruff Guide to Shakespeare

Marking the 400th year anniversary of his death, 'The Ruff Guide to Shakespeare', tells the tale of William Shakespeare (well, what we know of him). Six actors take the audience through the Seven Ages of Mankind, exploring the life of Shakespeare right through from birth to death. Expect silly songs, daft dance routines and a lot of crazy characters, also including some of his most famous speeches and all you need to know about the Elizabethan times.

The Ruff Guide captures the beauty of Shakespeare's writing whilst keeping it playful and educational. Designed for all the family, this is an all inclusive show with audience participation.

This will be Bristol Old Vic Theatre School's fifth consecutive visit to Edinburgh Fringe Festival following the great success of Romeo and Juliet, Twelfth Night, The Comedy of Errors and most recently, Julius Caesar.

 

So, for us to get this show to The Edinburgh Fringe, we need your help!  We are hoping to fund-raise enough money to cover venue hire, advertising, accommodation and living costs and we can't do that without your generosity!

Any kind of donation will be hugely appreciated!

If for any reason you are unable to donate but would still like to help? Please spread the word about The Ruff Guide to Shakespeare and our fundraising campaign.  The more interest the better and maybe, if we are lucky, we will see you in Edinburgh!  'The Ruff Guide to Shakespeare' will be showing at the Piccolo venue (Assembly Gardens) from 4th August-19th August.  

Ticket prices ranging from £5 - £9. 


Website: www.takethouthat.com

Twitter: @TakeThouThat

story:
Following a unhealthy breakup, God inspired me in 2007 to write  my second play entitled  " For Better or For Worse"  Its a drama and comedy all in one, DRAMEDY.

"For Better or For Worse" is a play that is heartrending and filled with significant messages throughout the play that  encourages audiences of all ages to choose relationships wisely. The plot surrounds around an unemployed husband tempted to go into a life of  crime . The marriage is tested when Renee (his wife) doesn’t want to support the choices of her husband’s street life. Marques  finds  it difficult to adapt to his wife’s  good girl lifestyle and does the unthinkable that causes his marriage to enter into the Danger Zone. "Our decision's determine our destiny. "

As  a new playwright and director I began to tour my play and solicit Investment. Although me and the cast have performed for over 25 shows, for audiences as low as 200 to as high as 1700 in one night, I was once told " An Inspirational Play is not Marketable"

Determined to pursue my goals, I'm reaching out for help. This campaign was created so that I can rent theater space in New York City and Promote my show in THE BIG CITY.  The funds will be utilized to primarily rent the  venue space, market in NYC & assist with the production budget for the show.

About Free to Fly Productions Inc.

Free to Fly Productions Inc was founded by Racquel Marie Jones as a Production Company dedicated to empowering individuals through the vehicle of arts & entertainment. Free to Fly is known for its quality performances that bring a higher level of entertainment to people of all walks of life. Your guaranteed to leave each theatrical performance forever changed.


 Luke 4:18 “The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised.”

story:
Who Are Theatre Rapscallions?

Visit Our Website

Theatre Rapscallions was created in 2015 with the goal of bringing new and rarely seen work to the D/FW area. With a mission to have over half of their programming be originally and locally scripted, Theatre Rapscallions is filling
its ambitious first season with Stay Carl Stay by Peter Tolan, David Mamet's Oleanna,  a 48 hour play fest this summer, a one act fest, featuring local and new playwrights, and a staged reading of various works by Dallas writer Steven Young  on March 19th. Theatre Rapscallions will also be staging performances at area bars, breweries and coffee shops through its Offstage Rapscallions Players.

While developing their inaugural season, Theatre Rapscallions quickly realized there was a need in D/FW for both new and original work as well as an opportunity for site-specific performances, bringing the stage to the community and not only relying on audiences coming to them. Immediately, a one act fest featuring only local work, a 48 hour play fest with scripts written, rehearsed and produced in that timeframe and The Offstage Rapscallions division of Theatre Rapscallions was added to that ambitious list of 2016 goals. Plans for a charitable division to work with young talent from under funded schools to write, produce and perform on the Rapscallions stage is in the works as well.

Theatre Rapscallions has a mission to entertain, challenge, inspire and nurture the cultural life of D/FW not only for the current community but future generations.

“For most of us, art, performing, is a luxury. We are so lucky to have the opportunity to do what we do and share the stories we are able to tell.” says managing director Stephanie Stone-Robb. “We want to now take this opportunity to tell stories, both original and previously produced, that might never get told otherwise. We want to make people laugh, make people think, and everything in between.”

What We Need & What You Get

Our $5000 goal is a just under half of our modest budget to produce our  shows this year and offer educational subsidies.  This will help to cover costs of costuming, set, performance rights and so much more.  

All of our perks are over on the right.  $10 donation will get you a signed and personalized post card from our crew at Theatre Rapscallions.  Feeling more generous?  We got you covered with show posters, season tickets, VIP events and more!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but want to support?  

  • Help spread this campaign! 
  • Are you in the Dallas area and want to volunteer?  Visit our site at www.theatrerapscallions.com to sign up!

story:
Who we are?

We are STAG, a Glasgow based theater company and this year we are taking our 2016 New Works festival winner 'A Dog's Tale' to the fringe, having been picked by a panel of professional theater makers . STAG have been taking a show to the fringe for the past nine years and we want to make sure that this year is the best yet!


So what is A Dog's Tale About?

In the ruff underworld of 1920s New York City, young puppy Johnny walks through the wrong doggy door and ends up the new piano player at Boney Maroney’s. While he wins the affections of the dogfather, as well as street smart waitress Mash, the question remains; what happened to the last piano player? And what’s that whispering on walkie-talkies all about?


What will your money go to?
Going to the fringe is not easy and costs quite a bit. When you donate you will be helping cover the cost of the venue, giving our cast and crew a place to live while in Edinburgh as well as the license to allow us to perform at the fringe! Any amount of money you want to donate to the show will be greatly appreciated by all of us here at Dogs HQ!


Other ways to help!

If you can't donate, don't worry you can still help! Simply by sharing our facebook or twitter would be a massive help to us. So go give us a like and a follow and start spreading the word. You'd be barking mad not to.

story:
About The Show

'If you hear this from anybody else, they’ll tell it wrong.’​

Texas, 1969. The country is bursting with vibes of peace, love and rock ‘n’ roll. Fronting a rock band, raising some hell, Jeannie’s a disgrace to her mother and having the time of her life.​

That is, until she’s dragged back to the oppressive small-town values of a home she’s outgrown. Stuck once again out in the remote Texas desert, Jeannie stews behind a locked door, desperate to escape.

But she has a confession to make first.​

This breathtaking new play stares straight at the collateral damage of a life led in search of a legacy, fusing electrifying live music with an extraordinary story that ‘packs a hell of a punch’.​

★★★★★ ‘Powerful… painfully contemporary’   Edinburgh Reporter

★★★★★ ‘Simply mesmerising’   The Public Reviews

★★★★★ ‘Highly recommended’   UK Theatre Web
★★★★ ‘Insightful and moving’   The Stage
★★★★ ‘Rigby is quite simply killing it’   A Younger Theatre
★★★★ ‘Full of lyrical power’   Fest
★★★★ ‘Compelling and nuanced’   The Skinny
★★★★ ‘Breathtaking. A definite must-see’   Everything Theatre
★★★★ ‘Not to be missed… will stay with you’   Backstage Pass
★★★★ ‘Wins the heart of her audience’   Theatre Fullstop
★★★★ ‘Compelling. A pleasure to watch’   Edfringe Review
★★★★ ‘Strong and engaging’   Broadway Baby
★★★★ ‘Extraordinary’   LondonTheatre1


The Team

WRITER & PERFORMER - Victoria Rigby

Victoria Rigby is a London-based actress and writer. She read English at Cambridge, and is an alumna of the Lyric Hammersmith Young Writers' Programme. She was shortlisted for the Lyric's Emerging Artists Prize for Girl From Nowhere.

Theatre includes Private Lives (ATG/UK Tour), Flowers of the Forest (Jermyn Street Theatre); Much Ado About Nothing (University of Cambridge/Japanese Tour); Blanche Dubois in A Streetcar Named Desire (University of Cambridge); Marianne in Sense and Sensibility (University of Cambridge); Sister James in Doubt: A Parable (University of Cambridge).

Film includes Tell Them of Us (WAGScreen); Return (Golden Lane Films); The Lady of Shalott (WAGScreen).

www.victoriarigby.com - @VictoriaCRigby 

DIRECTOR - Whitney Mosery

Whitney is a theatre and film director, dividing her time between London and New York. In 2014, she became the first American ever to receive a Masters in Theatre Directing from RADA, and the first Director in Residence at the Almeida Theatre under Artistic Director Rupert Goold.  Since then, she has directed world premieres of new plays and musicals in venues all over the world, including the New York Musicals Festival, Times Square’s Theatre Row, Ars Nova, Williamstown Theatre Festival, Theatre 503, Camden People’s Theatre, Dominion Theatre Studio, and a newly excavated amphitheatre in Messini, Greece.  She was also Associate Director of American Psycho (Broadway) and King Charles III (West End and Broadway), and Co-Director of the King Charles III International Tour.   

Current projects include co-writing and directing a new musical with Zoe Sarnak, and developing a new play with music by Spring Awakening’s Steven Sater and Duncan Sheik.  Whitney is also a frequent panelist and directing mentor, most recently at her alma mater, Princeton University. 

whitneymosery.com - @WhitneyMosery - Agent: Ally Shuster, CAA

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR​ - Quentin Beroud

Quentin is the Co-artistic Director of DIPPERMOUTH - “One of the UK’s best new theatre companies” - Anthony Biggs (AD, Jermyn Street Theatre). 

He recently directed Verge of Strife at Assembly Studios and co-directed Richard II at House of Parliment / Arcola. 

He directed Not About Heroes at the Matthews Yard Theatre. He co-directed the critically acclaimed Bombshells, starring Ellie Nunn, at the Jermyn Street Theatre (★★★★ “Captivating” Upcoming, ★★★★ “Flawless” RemoteGoat). 

He worked with Whitney Mosery (Associate Dir.: American Psycho: The Musical, King Charles III) on the critically acclaimed Girl From Nowhere at the Pleasance (★★★★★ “Powerful” Ed Reporter, ★★★★ “Full of lyrical power” Fest, ★★★★ The Stage, ★★★★ Skinny). In the last two years he has directed in venues across London, including at the VAULT Festival and The Arts Theatre - West End. He also produced the Christmas Show Scrooge & Marley (★★★★★ “the best show running this Christmas, and maybe even this year” RemoteGoat). His production of Simon Stephens' Bluebird garnered five-star reviews.

THE BAND

Dom Gee-Burch              Matthew Stevens            Tom Dixon

MD / Guitar                          Bass/ Harmonica                Drums

      

The Impact

Texas is the world of oil and big business. Rock music is owned by the Stones, Hendrix, Dylan and the Beatles. So where does a sweet Southern girl turn if she doesn't want to be a sweet Southern girl?

The stories of epic and tragic rises and falls from grace in the world of rock-and-roll are well documented, but rarely do we hear these stories told by a female protagonist. Locked in a room with only a tape recorder for company, Jeannie is determined to explain the creative quest that led her across the state, abandoning home and defying the expectations of a young woman in conservative America.

This 'breathtaking' story of a vibrant, gutsy, unconventional woman played to rave reviews at both Theatre503 and the Pleasance, Edinburgh in 2014 and 2015 respectively. We are thrilled to have the chance to develop the piece with a full band and present this epic piece to the St James audience. 


"That's the thing about women in the music business, man. Because women sing their fuckin' insides, man. Women, to be in the music business, give up more than you'd ever know." - Janis Joplin

These two nights at the St James are only the beginning. We have big plans for Girl From Nowhere; your support will allow us to give the show a life beyond these showings. We plan to take it to a top-notch London theatre for a full run, and it's crucial that we get the St James performances just right so we can show theatre programmers in London and beyond just why this show is so special.  

We will be so grateful for any support you can give. Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, there are other ways you can support us:

  • COME SEE THE SHOW at St James Theatre Studio 18-19 October 2016
    • Tickets HERE
  • Visit our website and have a look at all our images and trailers. 
  • Spread the word. Please share the links to the show and our funding page.

Theatre includes Private Lives (ATG/UK Tour), Flowers of the Forest (Jermyn Street Theatre); Much Ado About Nothing (University of Cambridge/Japanese Tour); Blanche Dubois in A Streetcar Named Desire (University of Cambridge); Marianne in Sense and Sensibility (University of Cambridge); Sister James in Doubt: A Parable (University of Cambridge).
Film includes Tell Them of Us (WAGScreen); Return (Golden Lane Films); The Lady of Shalott (WAGScreen).
www.victoriarigby.com - @VictoriaCRigby 
DIRECTOR - Whitney Mosery

Whitney is a theatre and film director, dividing her time between London and New York. In 2014, she became the first American ever to receive a Masters in Theatre Directing from RADA, and the first Director in Residence at the Almeida Theatre under Artistic Director Rupert Goold.  Since then, she has directed world premieres of new plays and musicals in venues all over the world, including the New York Musicals Festival, Times Square’s Theatre Row, Ars Nova, Williamstown Theatre Festival, Theatre 503, Camden People’s Theatre, Dominion Theatre Studio, and a newly excavated amphitheatre in Messini, Greece.  She was also Associate Director of American Psycho (Broadway) and King Charles III (West End and Broadway), and Co-Director of the King Charles III International Tour.   
Current projects include co-writing and directing a new musical with Zoe Sarnak, and developing a new play with music by Spring Awakening’s Steven Sater and Duncan Sheik.  Whitney is also a frequent panelist and directing mentor, most recently at her alma mater, Princeton University. 
whitneymosery.com - @WhitneyMosery - Agent: Ally Shuster, CAA
ASSISTANT DIRECTOR​ - Quentin Beroud

Quentin is the Co-artistic Director of DIPPERMOUTH - “One of the UK’s best new theatre companies” - Anthony Biggs (AD, Jermyn Street Theatre). 
He recently directed Verge of Strife at Assembly Studios and co-directed Richard II at House of Parliment / Arcola. 
He directed Not About Heroes at the Matthews Yard Theatre. He co-directed the critically acclaimed Bombshells, starring Ellie Nunn, at the Jermyn Street Theatre (★★★★ “Captivating” Upcoming, ★★★★ “Flawless” RemoteGoat). 
He worked with Whitney Mosery (Associate Dir.: American Psycho: The Musical, King Charles III) on the critically acclaimed Girl From Nowhere at the Pleasance (★★★★★ “Powerful” Ed Reporter, ★★★★ “Full of lyrical power” Fest, ★★★★ The Stage, ★★★★ Skinny). In the last two years he has directed in venues across London, including at the VAULT Festival and The Arts Theatre - West End. He also produced the Christmas Show Scrooge & Marley (★★★★★ “the best show running this Christmas, and maybe even this year” RemoteGoat). His production of Simon Stephens' Bluebird garnered five-star reviews.
THE BAND
Dom Gee-Burch              Matthew Stevens            Tom Dixon
MD / Guitar                          Bass/ Harmonica                Drums
      

The Impact
Texas is the world of oil and big business. Rock music is owned by the Stones, Hendrix, Dylan and the Beatles. So where does a sweet Southern girl turn if she doesn't want to be a sweet Southern girl?
The stories of epic and tragic rises and falls from grace in the world of rock-and-roll are well documented, but rarely do we hear these stories told by a female protagonist. Locked in a room with only a tape recorder for company, Jeannie is determined to explain the creative quest that led her across the state, abandoning home and defying the expectations of a young woman in conservative America.
This 'breathtaking' story of a vibrant, gutsy, unconventional woman played to rave reviews at both Theatre503 and the Pleasance, Edinburgh in 2014 and 2015 respectively. We are thrilled to have the chance to develop the piece with a full band and present this epic piece to the St James audience. 
"That's the thing about women in the music business, man. Because women sing their fuckin' insides, man. Women, to be in the music business, give up more than you'd ever know." - Janis Joplin
These two nights at the St James are only the beginning. We have big plans for Girl From Nowhere; your support will allow us to give the show a life beyond these showings. We plan to take it to a top-notch London theatre for a full run, and it's crucial that we get the St James performances just right so we can show theatre programmers in London and beyond just why this show is so special.  
We will be so grateful for any support you can give. Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you just can't contribute, there are other ways you can support us:

COME SEE THE SHOW at St James Theatre Studio 18-19 October 2016Tickets HERE


Visit our website and have a look at all our images and trailers. 
Spread the word. Please share the links to the show and our funding page.

story:
This Indiegogo campaign is to fund the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble's 17th Spring Season of performances in New York City and Houston, and the return of ARTCAST our free Internet Television Series that features new dance, music and film from multiple cities. 

The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble is a contemporary dance ensemble that specializes in commissioning new music for dance and incorporating musicians into the visual stage imagery. Sharing the stage and the focus, our dancers and musicians break the boundaries of traditional ensemble interaction. Performance works include original choreography and music as well as improvisation by all performers, creating a spontaneous performance environment where anything can happen. The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble is known for innovative format, bold subject matter, and wide range of music spanning from classical to jazz to avant-garde and experimental. 

Spring 2016 Season of Performances:

Our Spring 2016 Season features two premieres. A new work in our UnSanto Series that looks at changes to the food we eat and how this effects us, with choreography by Michele Brangwen and music by legendary bassist and composer Rufus Reid.


We will also be premiering a new work with choreography by Lindsey McGill and music by Hsin-Jung Tsai,

We will be performing on Saturday and Sunday April 23 & 24, 2016 at the brand new Midtown Arts & Theatre Center Houston (MATCH), and in May 2016 at the Mark Morris Dance Center.  In Summer 2016, ARTCAST, our Internet Television series will return to YouTube.

Performers for our Spring 2016 Season include Roberta Cortes, Robin Gilbert, Brit Wallis, Lindsey McGill, and Michele Brangwen, dancers; Rufus Reid, Tim Hagans, Seth Paynter, Thomas Helton, James Ilgenfritz, and Joe Hertenstein, musicians.

UNSANTO

Watch part 1 of our UNSANTO Series: SKAMATO

SKAMATO, our new ska influenced work for dancers, trumpet, sax, Sousaphone, double bass and percussion that celebrates the vine ripened non-GMO tomato. It was filmed by award-winning filmmaker Peter Josyph during a dress rehearsal at the Mark Morris Dance Center in New York. SKAMATO will be performed on the program at the MATCH on April 23 & 24. Read Michele Brangwen's blog on the inspiration for SKAMATO: https://artcastseason2.wordpress.com/2015/10/15/hey-michele-i-dont-want-to-hear-about-monsters-in-my-fridge/


More About the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble

In 2015 the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble performed at the Mark Morris Dance Center in October and was presented by the ShapeShifter Lab in May in New York City. We launched the Big Two-Hearted Festival, concerts of new dance and music in collaboration with the Houston Composers Salon at Studio 101 Theatre in Houston in June 2015.

In 2014, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble was presented by the Festival of New Trumpet Music at the Village Zendo in New York City, and premiered the 2nd Season of ARTCAST, our Internet Television Series that features new dance, music and film from multiple cities. We also performed at the Quantum Bass Center in Houston and made a new dance and music film based on John Cassavetes' landmark film "Shadows."

Watch Some of ARTCAST:



In June 2013 the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble premiered Season 1 of ARTCAST that featured dance, music and film created in Houston & New York. In January 2012, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble performed as part of Dance Theatre of Harlem’s Sunday Matineé Concert Series. Notable commissions include a new site-specific work for FotoFest International’s Biennial in April 2012. In December 2008 the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble traveled to Sweden to create a dance and music on camera project with the Norrbotten Big Band, an internationally acclaimed jazz ensemble based in Luleå. The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble returned to Sweden in December 2009 for live performances with the Norrbotten Big Band at the Stora Salen Theater in Luleå and the Akusticum Theater in Piteå.

The Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble has been featured at the Hobby Center for the Performing Arts in Houston, Texas as part of FotoFest’s 2006 International Biennial dedicated to the themes of The Earth and Artists Responding to Violence. We have been presented at Northwestern University by the International Society of Improvised Music; the Interart Annex in New York City by Creative Women New York, and three times at the Miller Outdoor Theater as part of the Annual Weekend of Texas Contemporary Dance.

Now entering our seventeenth season of performances, the Michele Brangwen Dance Ensemble has commissioned twenty-one new music works for dance. Composers include Tim Hagans, Seth Paynter, Thomas Helton, Rufus Reid, Brian Nelson, Carol Morgan, Reynaldo Ochoa, and Arthur Gottschalk.

story:
Ready Set! O-kay!

Hi guys! It's your friendly Facebook Cuzzin, Lonnie Colon.  I'm here to ask you to join me in supporting The Irving Bears/L.A.C.E.R. Drill Team.  The Drill Team is made up of four (4) amazing and dedicated young ladies.  The squad is part of the L.A.C.E.R. after school program and represents their school, Irving STEAM Magnet Middle School.  The L.A.C.E.R. program provides free arts and literacy based after school programs.   
This current team is the first drill team the middle school has had in over three years.  We started out with a 'strong seven', but due to scheduling conflicts and the newness of the squad, we now find ourselves with what I like to call, The Fortified Four!  These young ladies, along with their advisor Coach Karla, have dedicated their time and effort five days a week to becoming outstanding individual performers.  But more importantly they've become a strong unit that fights to get better each day. They are determined to represent their school and bring back the excitement of drill to Irving STEAM Magnet Middle School. That's why I call 'em The Fortified Four!

What We Need

 We are currently in the heart of cheer/drill/dance competition season and the girls have been working very hard on a new routine for 2016.  Last semester, representing the Irving Bears for first time in  three years, the girls went home with honorable mention.  Becoming known as one of the best "first year teams" in all of Los Angeles.  This semester the girls have set their sites on a greater challenge: two state wide competitions!  

Here's where we ask for your support.  We are looking for funding to help with the following:

  • New Uniforms that make a small squad stand out on the floor
  •  Supplies for further Drill Team funding efforts
  • Snacks for Drill Team during competitions (on average 4 to 8 hours)
  • T-Shirts for the parents and other team supporters

The Impact

 The main reason for the campaign is to ask that you help us, the parents, show these four young ladies how much we appreciate their work ethic.  When you are a team of only four, there's no place to hide.  So these girls really call each other to task and work to be on point with their routine.  Your support would help us to give them more of a presence on campus and to reward their efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount that you can give will be received with much appreciation.  Suggested donation is $5.00 and goes towards celebrating and strengthening the presence of the Irving Bears/L.A.C.E.R. drill team!

Please share this campaign with anyone you think may want to show support.  Please use the Indiegogo share tools.
